gurmukhi: ਪੳੁੜੀ ੧ ਮੂਲ ਮੰਗਲਾਚਰਣ
transliteration: X
translation: Invocation

gurmukhi: ਨਮਸਕਾਰ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਕੋ ਸਤਿਨਾਮ ਜਿਸ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Namasakaaru Guradayv Ko Sati Naamu Jisu Mantr Sounaaiaa.
translation: I bow before the Guru (Guru Nanak Dev) who recited the Satnam mantra(for the world).

gurmukhi: ਭਵਜਲ ਵਿਚੋਂ ਕਢਿ ਕੇ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਮਾਹਿ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhavajal Vichon Kaddhi Kai Moukati Padaarath Maahi Samaaiaa.
translation: Getting (the creatures) across the world ocean He raptly merged them in liberation.

gurmukhi: ਜਨਮ ਮਰਣ ਭੳੁ ਕਟਿਅਾ ਸੰਸਾ ਰੋਗ ਵਿਯੋਗ ਮਿਟਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Janam Maran Bhau Katiaa Sansaa Rogu Viyogu Mitaaiaa.
translation: He destroyed the fear of transmigration and decimated the malady of doubt and separation.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਸਾ ੲਿਹੁ ਸੰਸਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਣ ਵਿਚਿ ਦੁਖ ਸਬਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sansaa Ihu Sansaaru Hai Janam Maran Vichi Doukhu Savaaiaa.
translation: The world is only illusion which carried with it much of birth, death and sufferings.

gurmukhi: ਜਮ ਦੰਡ ਸਿਰੋਂ ਨਾ ੳੁਤਰੈ ਸਾਕਤ ਦੁਰਜਨ ਜਨਮੁ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jam Dandu Siraoun N Outarai Saakati Durajan Janamu Gavaaiaa.
translation: The fear of the rod of Yama is not dispelled and the sakts, the followers of the goddess, have lost their lives in vain.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਗਹੇ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਦੇ ਸਤਿ ਸਬਦ ਦੇ ਮੁਕਤ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charan Gahay Guradayv Day Sati Sabadu Day Moukati Karaaiaa.
translation: Those who have caught hold of the feet of the Guru have been liberated through the true Word.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਪੁਰਬ ਕਰਿ ਨਾਮ ਦਾਨ ੲਿਸਨਾਨ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ੍ਹ੍ਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhaau Bhagati Gurapurabi Kari Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirhaaiaa.
translation: Now being full of loving devotion they celebrate the gurprubs (anniversaries of the Gurus) and their acts of rememberance of God, charity and holy ablutions, inspire others also.

gurmukhi: ਜੇਹਾ ਬੀੳੁ ਤੇਹਾ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Jayhaa Beeu Tayhaa Phalu Paaiaa ?1?
translation: As someone sows, so he reaps.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁੜੀ ੨ ਜਗਦੁਤਪਤੀ
translation: Creation

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮੈ ਸਾਸ ਨ ਮਾਸ ਸਨ ਅੰਧ ਧੁੰਧ ਕਛੁ ਖਬਰ ਨ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pridamai Saasi N Maas Sani Andh Dhoundh Kachhu Khabari N Paaee.
translation: First of all, when no breath and body was there nothing was visible in the pitch darkness.

gurmukhi: ਰਕਤਬਿੰਦ ਕੀ ਦੇਹਿ ਰਚਿ ਪਾਂਚ ਤਤ ਕੀ ਜੜਤ ਜੜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Rakati Bind Kee Dayhi Rachi Panchi Tat Kee Jarhit Jarhaaee.
translation: The body was created through the blood(of mother) and semen (of father) and the five elements were joined judiciously.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁਣ ਪਾਣੀ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੋ ਚੳੁਥੀ ਧਰਤੀ ਸੰਗਿ ਮਿਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Paoun Paanee Baisantaro Chauthee Dharatee Sangi Milaaee.
translation: Air, water, fire and earth was put together.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਚਮਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾਕਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਤਾ ਛਟਮੁ ਅਦਿਸਟੁ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Panchami Vichi Aakaasu Kari Karataa Chhatamu Adisatu Samaaee.
translation: The fifth element sky (void) was kept in between and creator God, the sixth one, invisibly permeated among all.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਚ ਤਤ ਪੰਚੀਸ ਗੁਨਿ ਸਤ੍ਰ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ ਮਿਲਿ ਦੇਹਿ ਬਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Panch Tat Pancheesi Gouni Satr Mitr Mili Dayhi Banaaee.
translation: To create the human body, five elements and twenty five qualities opposite to each other were joined and mixed.

gurmukhi: ਖਾਣੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਚਲਿਤੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਵਾਗੳੁਣੁ ਚਰਿਤ੍ਰ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Khaanee Baanee Chalitu Kari Aavaa Gaounu Charit Dikhaaee.
translation: Four life originating mines (egg foetus sweatborn , vegetation) and four speeches(para, pasyanti, madhyama, vaikhari) were assimiliated into each other andthe drama of transmigration was enacted.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀਹ ਲਖ ਜੋਨਿ ੳੁਪਾੲੀ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Chauraaseeh Lakh Joni Oupaaee ?2?
translation: Thus eighty four lacs of species were created.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁੜੀ ੩ ਮਨੁੱਖ ਜਨਮ ਦੀ ੳੁੱਤਮਤਾ
translation: Grandeur of human birth

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀਹ ਲਖ ਜੋਨਿ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਤਮੁ ਜਨਮੁ ਸੁ ਮਾਣਸਿ ਦੇਹੀ
transliteration: Chauraaseeh Lakh Joni Vichi Outamu Janamu Su Maanasi Dayhee.
translation: Of the eighty four lacs life classes, birth as a human is the best.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀ ਵੇਖਣੁ ਕਰਨਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਭ ਬੋਲਣੁ ਬਚਨ ਸਨੇਹੀ
transliteration: Akhee Vaykhanu Karani Souni Moukhi Soubhi Bolani Bachan Sanayhee.
translation: Eyes behold, ears listen to and the mouth speaks sweet words.

gurmukhi: ਹਥੀ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾਵਣੀ ਪੈਰੀ ਚਲਿ ਸਤਿਸੰਗਿ ਮਿਲੇਹੀ
transliteration: Hathee Kaar Kamaavanee Pairee Chali Satisangi Milayhee.
translation: Hands earn livelihood and feet take towards the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਤਿ ਵਿਰਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਧਰਮ ਦੀ ਖਟਿ ਖਵਾਲਣੁ ਕਾਰਿ ਕਰੇਹੀ
transliteration: Kirati Virati Kari Dharam Dee Khati Khavaalanu Kaari Karayhee.
translation: In human life alone by the rightful earning, out of one's savings, other needy ones are fed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਨਮੁ ਸਕਾਰਥਾ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਪੜਿ ਸਮਝਿ ਸੁਣੇਹੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Janamu Sakaaradaa Gurabaanee Parhhi Samajhi Sounayhee.
translation: Man by becoming gurmukh- Guru oriented, makes his life meaningful; he reads Gurbani and makes others understand (the importance of) bani.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ ਸੰਤੁਸਟਿ ਕਰਿ ਚਰਣਾਮਿਤੁ ਲੈ ਮੁਖਿ ਪਿਵੇਹੀ
transliteration: Gurabhaaee Santousati Kari Charanaamrit Lai Moukhi Pivayhee.
translation: He satisfies his companions and takes the holy water touched by their feet i.e. he inculcates complete humility.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪਵਣੁ ਨ ਛੋਡੀਅੈ ਕਲੀ ਕਾਲਿ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰੇਹੀ
transliteration: Pairee Pavanu N Chhodeeai Kalee Kaali Raharaasi Karayhee.
translation: Humblytouching of the feet should not be repudiated because in the dark age, this quality is the only asset (of the human personality).

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਿ ਤਰੇ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਤਰੇਹੀ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Aapi Taray Gur Sikh Tarayhee ?3?
translation: People of such a conduct will swim the world-ocean and also get along other disciples of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁੜੀ ੪ ਜਗਤ ਕਾਰਣ
translation: Creation

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰੁ ਅਾਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ੲੇਕ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਪਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Aoankaaru Aakaaru Kari Ayk Kavaau Pasaau Pasaaraa.
translation: All prevading Oankar through His One Word created the whole expansive cosmos.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜ ਤਤ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ਕਰਿ ਘਟਿ ਘਟਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਭਵਣੁ ਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Panj Tat Paravaanu Kari Ghati Ghati Andari Tribhavanu Saaraa.
translation: Through the five elements, as the quintessence He permeated in the three worlds and their denominations.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਦਰੁ ਕਿਨੇ ਨ ਲਖਿਅਾ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਸਾਜਿ ਕੀਅਾ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kaadaru Kinay N Lakhiaa Kudarati Saaji Keeaa Avataaraa.
translation: That creator could not be seen by anyone who to expand Himself created the infinite nature(prakrti).

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਦੂ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਲਖ ਕਰਿ ਲਖ ਬਿਅੰਤ ਅਸੰਖ ਅਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Ik Doo Kudarati Lakh Kari Lakh Biant Asankh Apaaraa.
translation: He made myriad forms of nature.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਮ ਰੋਮ ਵਿਚ ਰਖਿਓਨ ਕਰਿ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡਿ ਕਰੋੜਿ ਸੁਮਾਰਾ
transliteration: Romi Romi Vichi Rakhiaoni Kari Brahamandi Karorhi Soumaaraa.
translation: In His each one hair He gethered up millions of worlds.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਸ ੲਿਕਸ ਬ੍ਹਿਮੰਡਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਦਸ ਦਸ ਕਰਿ ਅਵਤਾਰ ੳੁਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Ikasi Ikasi Brahamandi Vich Dasi Dasi Kari Avataar Outaaraa.
translation: And then in one universe He comes in tens of forms.

gurmukhi: ਕੇਤੇ ਬੇਦ ਬਿਅਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਕੲੀ ਕਤੇਬ ਮੁਹੰਮਦ ਯਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kaytay Baydi Biaas Kari Kaee Katayb Muhanmad Yaaraa.
translation: He has created many a dear personality such as Vedavyas and Muhammad dear to the Vedas and the Katebas respectively.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ੲਿਕੁ ੲੇਤਾ ਪਾਸਾਰਾ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Kudarati Iku Aytaa Paasaaraa ?4?
translation: How wonderfully the one nature has been expanded into many.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁੜੀ ੫ ਜੁੱਗ ਅਾਦਿਕ
translation: The Yugs

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਜੁਗਿ ਕਰਿ ਥਾਪਨਾ ਸਤਿਜੁਗ ਤ੍ਰੇਤਾ ਦੁਅਾਪਰੁ ਸਾਜੇ
transliteration: Chaari Jougi Kari Daapanaa Satijougu Traytaa Duaapar Saajay.
translation: The four Ages (yugs) were established and the first three were given names Satyug, Treta, Dvapar. Fourth one was Kaliyug.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਥਾ ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਥਾਪਿਅਾ ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨਿ ਚਾਰੋਂ ਕੇ ਰਾਜੇ
transliteration: Chaudaa Kalijougu Daapiaa Chaari Varani Chaaron Kay Raajay.
translation: And four castes came to be known as the kings of four ages. Brahmin, kshatriya, vaishya and sudhra became predominate in each age.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਣ ਛਤ੍ਰੀ ਵੈਸ ਸੂਦ੍ਰ ਜੁਗੁ ਜੁਗੁ ੲੇਕੋ ਵਰਨ ਬਿਰਾਜੇ
transliteration: Brahamani Chhatree Vaisi Soodri Jougu Jougu Ayko Varan Biraajay.
translation: In Satiyug, Vishnu is said to have come to earth as Hansavaar and explained the problems pertaining to

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗਿ ਹੰਸ ਅੳੁਤਾਰੁ ਧਰਿ ਸੋਹੰ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਨ ਦੂਜਾ ਪਾਜੇ
transliteration: Satijougi Hansu Aoutaaru Dhari Sohan Brahamu N Doojaa Paajay.
translation: Metaphysics (The story is there in the eleventh canto of the Bhagvat Purana), and nothing but one soham-Brahm was discussed and pondered upon.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕੋ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਮੋਹ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਤੇ ਬੇਮੁਹਤਾਜੇ
transliteration: Ayko Brahamu Vakhaaneeai Moh Maaiaa Tay Baymuhataajay.
translation: Getting indifferent to maya, people would praise one Lord.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਨਿ ਤਪਸਿਅਾ ਬਨਿ ਵਿਖੈ ਵਖਤ ਗੁਜਾਰਨਿ ਪਿੰਨੀ ਸਾਗੇ
transliteration: Karani Tapasiaa Bani Vikhai Vakhatu Gujaarani Pinnee Saagay.
translation: They would go to forests and pull on life by eating natural vegetations.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਵਰ੍ਹਿਅਾ ਦੀ ਅਾਰਜਾ ਕੋਠੇ ਕੋਟਿ ਨ ਮੰਦਿਰ ਸਾਜੇ
transliteration: Lakhi Varhiaan Dee Aarajaa Kotday Koti N Mandari Saajay.
translation: Though they lived for lacs of years but they would construct the palaces, forts and grand mansions.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਬਿਨਸੈ ੲਿਕ ਅਸਥਿਰੁ ਗਾਜੇ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Ik Binasai Ik Asadiru Gaajay ?5?
translation: On the one hand the world was passing away and on the other the life current would go stably.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਤਥਾਚ
translation: As Above

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੇਤੇ ਛਤ੍ਰੀ ਰੂਪ ਧਰਿ ਸੂਰਜ ਬੰਸੀ ਵਡਿ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Traytay Chhatree Roop Dhari Sooraj Bansee Vadi Avataaraa.
translation: In Treta in the Sun-dynasty descended in the form of the kshatriya(Ram) a great incarnation.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਹਿਸੇ ਗੲੀ ਅਾਰਜਾ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੋਹੁ ਅਹੰਕਾਰੁ ਪਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Nau Hisay Gaee Aarajaa Maaiaa Mohu Ahankaaru Pasaaraa.
translation: Now the nine portions of age lessened and illusion,attachment and ego inflated.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਅਾਪੁਰਿ ਜਾਦਵ ਵੇਸ ਕਰਿ ਜੁਗਿ ਜੁਗਿ ਅੳੁਧ ਘਟੈ ਅਾਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Duaapuri Jaadav Vans Kari Jougi Jougi Audh Ghatai Aachaaraa.
translation: In Dvapar, Yadav-dynasty came to the forefront i.e. the incarnation of Krsna became known to the people; but because of the lack of good conduct, Age by Age, the life span(of man) went on decreasing.

gurmukhi: ਰਿਗ ਬੇਦ ਮਹਿ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਕ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਪੂਰਬ ਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਭ ਕਰਮ ਬਿਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Rig Bayd Mahi Braham Kriti Poorab Moukhi Soubh Karam Bichaaraa.
translation: In the Rgveda the conduct of the brahmin and the ideas about the actions done facing the East were discussed.

gurmukhi: ਖਤ੍ਰੀ ਥਾਪੇ ਜੁਜਰੁ ਵੇਦਿ ਦੇਖਣ ਮੁਖਿ ਬਹੁ ਦਾਨ ਦਾਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Khatree Daapay Jujaru Vaydi Daykhan Moukhi Bahu Daan Daataaraa.
translation: Kshatriyas became related to the Yajurveda and started pouring charities while facing the South.

gurmukhi: ਵੈਸੋਂ ਥਾਪਿਅਾ ਸਿਅਾਮ ਵੇਦੁ ਪਛਮ ਮੁਖਿ ਕਰਿ ਸੀਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਰਾ
transliteration: Vaison Daapiaa Siaam Vaydu Pachhamu Moukhi Kari Seesu Nivaaraa.
translation: The vaishyas embraced the Samaveda and bowed to the West.

gurmukhi: ਰਿਗਿ ਨੀਲੰਬਰਿ ਜੁਜਰ ਪੀਤ ਸ੍ਵੇਤੰਬਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਿਅਾਮ ਸੁਧਾਰਾ
transliteration: Rigi Neelabari Jujar Peet Saytanbari Kari Siaam Sudhaaraa.
translation: Blue dress for Rgveda, yellow for Yajurveda and for singing of the hymns of Samaveda wearing of the white dress became a tradition.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਹਿੁ ਜੁਗੀ ਤ੍ਰੈ ਧਰਮ ੳੁਚਾਰਾ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Trihu Jougee Trai Dharam Ouchaaraa ?6?
translation: Thus three duties of the three Ages were enunciated.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਤਥਾਚ
translation: As Above

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਚੳੁਥਾ ਥਾਪਿਅਾ ਸੂਦ੍ਰ ਬਿਰਤਿ ਜਗ ਮਹਿ ਵਰਤਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kalijougu Chaudaa Daapiaa Soodr Birati Jag Mahi Varataaee.
translation: Kalijug became prevalent as the fourth age in which the low instincts gripped the whole world.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮ ਸੁ ਰਿਗਿ ਜੁਜਰ ਸਿਅਾਮ ਕੇ ਕਰੇ ਜਗਤੁ ਰਿਦਿ ਬਹੁ ਸੁਕਚਾੲੀ
transliteration: Karam Su Rigi Jujar Siaam Kay Karay Jagatu Ridi Bahu Soukachaaee.
translation: People became resultant in performing of the duties enjoined in the Rig, Yajur and Samaveda.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਹਿਅਾ ਮੋਹੀ ਮੇਦਨੀ ਕਲਿ ਕਲਿ ਵਾਲੀ ਸਭਿ ਭਰਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maaiaa Mohee Maydanee Kali Kalivaalee Sabhi Bharamaaee.
translation: The entire earth got enticed by mammon and the antics of the Kalijug put everyone into delusion.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੀ ਗਿਲਾਨਿ ਜਗਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਜਲੈ ਲੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Outthee Gilaani Jagatri Vichi Haoumai Andari Jalai Loukaaee.
translation: Hatred and degeneracy engrossed the people and ego burnt oneand all.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲਿ ਨਾ ਕਿਸੈ ਪੂਜਦਾ ੳੂਚ ਨੀਚ ਸਭਿ ਗਤਿ ਬਿਸਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Koi N Kisai Poojadaa Ooch Neech Sabhi Gati Bisaraaee.
translation: Nobody now worships anyone and the sense of respect for the younger and elder has vanished into thin air.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੇ ਬਿਅਦਲੀ ਪਾਤਸਾਹ ਕਲਿ ਕਾਤੀ ੳੁਮਰਾੲਿ ਕਸਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaay Biadalee Paatasaah Kali Kaatee Oumaraai Kasaaee.
translation: In this cutter age the emporers are tyrants and their satraps butchers.

gurmukhi: ਰਹਿਅਾ ਤਪਾਵਸੁ ਤ੍ਹਿੁ ਜੁਗੀ ਚੳੁਥੇ ਜੁਗਿ ਜੋ ਦੇੲਿ ਸੁ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Rahiaa Tapaavasu Trihu Jougee Chauday Jougi Jo Dayi Su Paaee.
translation: The justice of three ageshas become extinct and now whosoever gives something (as bribe) gets (justice?).

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮ ਭ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਸਭਿ ਭੲੀ ਲੋਕਾੲੀ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Karam Bhrisati Sabhi Bhaee Lokaaee ?7?
translation: The mankind has become wanting in dexterity of action.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਖਟ ਸ਼ਾਸਤ੍ਰ
translation: Six philosiphies

gurmukhi: ਚਹੁ ਬੇਦਾਂ ਕੇ ਧਰਮ ਮਥਿ ਖਟਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਕਥਿ ਰਿਖਿ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Chahu Baydaan Kay Dharam Madi Khati Saasatr Kadi Rikhi Sounaavai.
translation: Having churned the duties enjoined in the four Vedas, the seers have delineated the six Shastras.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾਦਿਕ ਸਨਕਾਦਿਕਾ ਜਿੳੁ ਤਿਹਿ ਕਹਾ ਤਿਵੈ ਜਗੁ ਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Brahamaadik Sanakaadikaa Jiu Tihi Kahaa Tivai Jagu Gaavai.
translation: What ever was described by Brahma and Sanak, people recited and followed.

gurmukhi: ਗਾਵਨਿ ਪੜਨਿ ਬਿਚਾਰਿ ਬਹੁ ਕੋਟਿ ਮਧੇ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਗਤਿ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Gaavani Parhani Bichaari Bahu Koti Madhay Viralaa Gati Paavai.
translation: Many think over while reading and singing, but only one among millions understands and reads between the lines.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹਿ ਅਚਰਜ ਮਨ ਅਾਵਦੀ ਪੜਤਿ ਗੁਣਤਿ ਕਛੁ ਭੇਦੁ ਨ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ihi Acharaju Man Aavadee Parhati Gounati Kachhu Bhaydu N Paavai.
translation: Many think over while reading and singing, but only one among millions understands and reads between the lines.

gurmukhi: ਜੁਗ ਜੁਗ ੲਿਕੋ ਵਰਨ ਹੈ ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਕਿੳੁ ਬਹੁਤੇ ਦਿਖਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Joug Joug Ayko Varan Hai Kalijougi Kiu Bahoutay Dikhalaavai.
translation: It is suprising that every age had dominance of one colour (caste) but how in Kaliyug myriads of castes are there.

gurmukhi: ਜੰਦ੍ਰੇ ਵਜੇ ਤ੍ਹਿੁ ਜੁਗੀ ਕਥਿ ਪੜ੍ਹਿ ਰਹੈ ਭਰਮ ਨਹਿ ਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jandray Vajay Trihu Jougee Kadi Parhhi Rahai Bharamu Nahi Jaavai.
translation: That the duties of all the three Yugas have been abandoned is known to everybody but the confusion persists.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਕਥਿਅਾ ਚਾਰਿ ਬੇਦਿ ਖਟਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰਿ ਸੰਗਿ ਸਾਖ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jiu Kari Kadiaa Chaari Baydi Khati Saasatri Sangi Saakhi Sounaavai.
translation: As the four Vedas have been defined, the description of the six philosophies (Shastras) also complements them.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੋ ਅਾਪਣੇ ਮਤ ਸਭਿ ਗਾਵੈ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Aapo Aapanay Mati Sabhi Gaavai ?8?
translation: They all eulogise their own view point.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਨਯਾਯ
translation: Nyaya

gurmukhi: ਗੋਤਮ ਤਪੇ ਬਿਚਾਰਿ ਕੈ ਰਿਗਿ ਵੇਦ ਕੀ ਕਥਾ ਸੁਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Gotim Tapay Bichaari Kai Rigi Vayd Kee Kadaa Sounaaee.
translation: Speculating seriously, seer Gotama has put forth the story of the Rgveda.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਕੌ ਮਥਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਭਿ ਬਿਧਿ ਕਰਤੇ ਹਥਿ ਜਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Niaai Saasatri Kau Madi Kari Sabhi Bidhi Karatay Hadi Janaaee.
translation: After churning the thoughts, in the Nyaya school, God  has been defined as the efficient cause of all the causes.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਕਛੁ ਕਰਤੇ ਵਸਿ ਹੈ ਹੋਰ ਬਾਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਚਲੇ ਨ ਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sabh Kachhu Karatay Vasi Hai Hori Baati Vichi Chalay N Kaaee.
translation: Everything is under His control and in His order, no order whatsoever of anybody else is accepted.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਹੀ ਸਿਰੀ ਕਰਤਾਰ ਹੈ ਅਾਪਿ ਨਿਅਾਰਾ ਕਰਿ ਦਿਖਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Duhee Siree Karataaru Hai Aapi Niaaraa Kari Dikhalaaee.
translation: He is in the beginning and at the end of this creation yet in this Shastra he is shown as separate from this creation.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਤਾ ਕਿਨੈ ਨ ਦੇਖਿਅਾ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Karataa Kinai N Daykhiaa Kudarati Andari Bharami Bhulaaee.
translation: No one has seen or known this creator, and rather people have remained indulged in the expansive delusions of prakriti (nature).

gurmukhi: ਸੋਹੰ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਛਪਾੲਿਕੈ ਪੜਦਾ ਭਰਮੁ ਕਰਤਾਰੁ ਸੁਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sohan Brahamu Chhapaai Kai Parhadaa Bharamu Karataaru Sounaaee.
translation: Not realising that soham parbrahm, the jiv is mistaken in understanding Him as a man (full of fallacies).

gurmukhi: ਰਿਗੁ ਕਹੈ ਸੁਣਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਹੁ ਅਾਪੇ ਅਾਪਿ ਨ ਦੂਜੀ ਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Rigi Kahai Souni Guramoukhahu Aapay Aapi N Doojee Raaee.
translation: The Rgveda exhorts the knowledgeable people that supreme Lord is everything and none else can be compared with Him.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਬਿਨਾ ਨ ਸੋਝੀ ਪਾੲੀ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Satigur Binaa N Sojhee Paaee ?9?
translation: Without true Guru this understanding cannot be attained.
Mimansa

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਜੈਮਨਿ ਰਿਖੁ ਬੋਲਿਅਾ ਜੁਜਰ ਵੇਦਿ ਮਥਿ ਕਥਾ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dhiri Jaimani Rikhu Boliaa Jujari Vaydi Madi Kadaa Sounaavai.
translation: Pondering deeply over the Yajurveda, rishi Jaimini putforth his postulates.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮਾ ੳੁਤੇ ਨਿਬੜੈ ਦੇਹੀ ਮਧਿ ਕਰੇ ਸੋ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Karamaa Outay Nibarhai Dayhee Madhi Karay So Paavai.
translation: Ultimate decision will be arrived at according to the actions performed through the body which will reap whatever it has sowed.

gurmukhi: ਥਾਪਸਿ ਕਰਮ ਸੰਸਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਰਮ ਵਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਵੈ ਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Daapasi Karam Sansaar Vichi Karam Vaas Kari Aavai Jaavai.
translation: He established the theory of karma and explained transmigration as controlled by karma.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸਾ ਮਨਹੁ ਨਾ ਚੁਕੲੀ ਕਰਮਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sahasaa Manahu N Choukaee Karamaan Andari Bharami Bhulaavai.
translation: Because of its fallacy of ad-infinitum, the doubts are cleared and the jiv goes on wandering in the labyrinth of karmas.

gurmukhi: ਭਰਮਿ ਵਰਤਣਿ ਜਗਤਿ ਕੀ ੲਿਕੋ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਕਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Karami Varatani Jagati Kee Iko Maaiaa Braham Kahaavai.
translation: Karma is a practical aspect of the world and the maya and the Brahm are identical.

gurmukhi: ਜੁਜਰ ਵੇਦ ਕੋ ਮਥਨਿ ਕਰਿ ਤਤ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਵਿਚਿ ਭਰਮਿ ਕਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jujari Vaydi Ko Madani Kari Tat Brahamu Vichi Bharamu Milaavai.
translation: This school of thought (Shastra) while stirring the ingredients of Yajurveda, mixes delusions with the supreme reality the Brahm,

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾੲਿ ਜਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਰਮ ਬੰਧਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਵੈ ਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Karam Drirhaai Jagat Vichi Karam Bandhi Kari Aavai Jaavai.
translation: And establishes strongly the ritualism which further accepts coming in and going from the world as the result of the karma bondage.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਬਿਨਾ ਨ ਸਹਸਾ ਜਾਵੈ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Satigur Binaa N Sahasaa Jaavai ?10?
translation: Without the true Guru, the doubts cannot be dispelled away.
Vedanta

gurmukhi: ਸਿਅਾਮ ਵੇਦ ਕੳੁ ਸੋਧਿ ਕਰਿ ਮਥਿ ਵੇਦਾਂਤੁ ਬਿਅਾਸਿ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Siaam Vayd Kau Sodhi Kari Madi Vaydaantu Biaasi Sounaaiaa.
translation: Vyas (Badarayan) recited Vedanta (sutras) after churning and researching the thought frame of the Samaveda.

gurmukhi: ਕਥਨੀ ਬਦਨੀ ਬਾਹਰਾ ਅਾਪੇ ਅਪਣਾ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kadanee Badanee Baaharaa Aapay Apanaa Brahamu Janaaiaa.
translation: He put up before the self  (atman) as identical to indescribable Brahm.

gurmukhi: ਨਦਰੀ ਕਿਸੈ ਨ ਲਿਅਾਵੲੀ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Nadaree Kisai N Liaavaee Haoumai Andari Bharami Bhulaaiaa.
translation: He in invisible and the jiv wanders hither and thither in its delusions of self conceit.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਪੁਜਾੲਿ ਜਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਦਾ ਮਰਮੁ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aapu Pujaai Jagat Vichi Bhaau Bhagati Daa Maramu N Paaiaa.
translation: By establishing the self as the Brahm he is in fact established one's own self as worthy of worship and therefore remained unknown to the mysteries of loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿਪਤਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੀ ਵੇਦਿ ਮਥਿ ਅਗਨੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਤਪਤਿ ਤਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Tripati N Aavee Vaydi Madi Aganee Andari Tapati Tapaaiaa.
translation: Churning of the Vedas could not obtain peace for him and he started scorching one and all in the heat of is ego.

gurmukhi: ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਡੰਡ ਨ ੳੁਤੇਰੇ ਜਮ ਡੰਡੇ ਬਹੁ ਦੁਖਿ ਰੂਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Maaiaa Dand N Outaray Jam Dandai Bahu Doukhi Rooaaiaa.
translation: The rod of maya always hung over his head and he suffered extremely because of the constant fear of the Yama, the god of death.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਦਿ ਮੁਨਿ ੳੁਪਦੇਸਿਅਾ ਮਥਿ ਭਾਗਵਤ ਗੁਨਿ ਗੀਤ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Naaradi Mouni Oupadaysiaa Madi Bhaagavat Gouni Geet Karaaiaa.
translation: Having obtained knowledge from Narad, he recited Bhagvat and thus eulogised God.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੁ ਸਰਨੀ ਨਹਿ ਕੋੲਿ ਤਰਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Binu Saranee Nahi Koi Taraaiaa ?11?
translation: Without surrender before the Guru none could get across (the world ocean).
Sankhaya

gurmukhi: ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਜੁਗਿ ਬੀਤਤ ਭੲੇ ਕਲਜੁਗਿ ਕੇ ਸਿਰਿ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਫਿਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Duaapari Jougi Beetat Bhaay Kalajougi Kay Siri Chhatr Dhiraaee.
translation: With the passing away of Dvapar, the canopy of kingdom now came over the head of Kaliyuga.

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਅਥਰਬਣਿ ਥਾਪਿਅਾ ੳੁਤਰਿ ਮੁਖਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗੁਨਗਾੲੀ
transliteration: Vayd Adaravani Daapiaa Outari Moukhi Guramoukhi Goun Gaaee.
translation: Atharvaveda got established and people now would go on eulogising, facing the north direction.

gurmukhi: ਕਪਲ ਰਿਖੀਸੁਰਿ ਸਾਂਖ ਮਥਿ ਅਥਰਬਣਿ ਵੇਦ ਕੀ ਰਿਚਾ ਸੁਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kapal Rikheesuri Saankhi Madi Adaravani Vayd Kee Richaa Sounaaee.
translation: As a substance of the hymns of Athrvaveda, the Sankhya-sutras were recited by sage Kapil.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨ ਮਹਾ ਰਸ ਪੀਅ ਕੈ ਸਿਮਰੇ ਨਿਤ ਅਨਿਤ ਨਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Giaan Mahaa Ras Peea Kai Simaray Nit Anit Niaaee.
translation: Get imbued with the great knowledge and go on pondering over the stable and the transitory.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨ ਬਿਨਾ ਨਹਿ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ ਜੇ ਕੋੲੀ ਕੋਟਿ ਜਤਨ ਕਰਿ ਧਾੲੀ
transliteration: Giaan Binaa Nahi Paaeeai Jo Koee Koti Jatani Kari Dhaaee.
translation: Despite millions of efforts, without knowledge nothing can be attained.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮ ਜੋਗ ਦੇਹੀ ਕਰੇ ਸੋ ਅਨਿਤ ਖਿਨ ਟਿਕੇ ਨ ਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Karami Jog Dayhee Karay So Anit Khin Tikay N Raaee.
translation: Karma and yoga are activities of the body and both these are momentry and perishable.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨ ਮਤੇ ਸੁਖੁ ੳੂਪਜੈ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨ ਕਾ ਭਰਮੁ ਚੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Giaanu Matay Soukhu Oopajai Janam Maran Kaa Bharamu Choukaaee.
translation: Analytical wisdom creates the supreme delight and the illusions of birth and death come to an end.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾੲੀ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Giaanee Sahaji Samaaee ?12?
translation: The Guru-oriented (gurmukh) get merged in the real self.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਵੈਸ਼ੇਖਕ
translation: Vaisesik

gurmukhi: ਬੇਦ ਅਥਰਬਨ ਮਥਨ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬਾਸੇਖਿਕ ਗੁਨ ਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Bayd Abarabanu Madani Kari Guramoukhi Baasaykhik Goun Gaavai.
translation: By churning of the Athatvaveda, the guru-oriented (Kanad) in his Vaisesik recited about gunas, the qualities (of the matter).

gurmukhi: ਜੇਹਾ ਬੀਜੈ ਸੋ ਲੁਣੈ ਸਮੇ ਬਿਨਾ ਫਲ ਹਥਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jayhaa Beejai So Lounai Samay Binaa Phalu Hadi N Aavai.
translation: He produced the theory of sowing and reaping(giving and taking) and told that at appropriate time only, one would attain the fruit.

gurmukhi: ਹੁਕਮੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਭੁ ਕੋ ਮੰਨੈ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਸੋ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Houkamai Andari Sabhu Ko Mannai Houkamu So Sahaji Samaavai.
translation: Everything operates in His divine will, hukam(to which he calls apurva) and whosoever accepts the divine-will stablizes his self in equanimity.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੋ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਹੋਵੲੀ ਬੁਰਾ ਭਲਾ ਨਹਿ ਮੰਨਿ ਵਸਾਵੈ
transliteration: Aapo Kachhoo N Hovaee Buraa Bhalaa Nahi Manni Vasaavai.
translation: The jiva must understand that nothing happens of its own (and our ownselves are responsible for our good or bad actions) and hence nobody as good or bad should be lodged in mind.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸਾ ਕਰਿ ਤੈਸਾ ਲਹੈ ਰਿਖਿ ਕਣਾਦਿਕ ਭਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jaisaa Kari Taisaa Lahai Rikhi Kanaadik Bhaakhi Sounaavai.
translation: Rishi Kanad has said that as you sow, so shall you reap.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗਿ ਕਾ ਅਨਿਅਾੲਿ ਸੁਣਿ ੲਿਕ ਫੇੜੇ ਸਭੁ ਜਗਤ ਮਰਾਵੈ
transliteration: Satijougi Kaa Aniaai Souni Ik Dhayrhay Sabhu Jagat Maraavai.
translation: Listen to the injustice of the satyug that only because of a single evil-doer the whole world would suffer.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੇਤੇ ਨਗਰੀ ਪੀੜੀਅੈ ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਵੰਸੁ ਕੁਵੰਸ ਕੁਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Traytay Nagaree Peerheeai Duaapari Vansu Kuvans Kuhaavai.
translation: In the treta, the whole city  suffered because of one evil-doer and in dvapar this suffering was limited to the one family and the family underwent the igominy.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਜੋ ਫੇੜੇ ਸੋ ਪਾਵੈ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Kalijoug Jo Dhayrhay So Paavai ?13?
translation: But in the kaliyug only he suffers who commits evil deed.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਨਾਗ-ਸ਼ੇਸ਼ਨਾਗ, ਪਾਤੰਜਲ
translation: Sesanag Patanjali-,

gurmukhi: ਸੇਖਨਾਗ ਪਾਤੰਜਲ ਮਥਿਅਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਗਿ ਸੁਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saykhanaag Paatanjal Madiaa Guramoukhi Saasatr Naagi Sounaaee.
translation: Gurmukh Patanjali the (supposed) incarnation of the Sesnaga, very thoughtfully recited, the Naga-Shastra, Yoga Shastra (Patanjal-Yogasutras).

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਅਥਰਬਣ ਬੋਲਿਅਾ ਜੋਗ ਬਿਨਾ ਨਹਿ ਭਰਮੁ ਚੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Vayd Adaravan Boliaa Jog Binaa Nahi Bharamu Choukaaee.
translation: He told in consonance with Atharvaveda that illusion cannot be erased without yoga.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਮੈਲੀ ਅਾਰਸੀ ਸਿਕਲ ਬਿਨਾ ਨਹਿ ਮੁਖਿ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jiu Kari Mailee Aarasee Sikal Binaa Nahi Moukhi Dikhaaee.
translation: It is similar to the fact where we know that without cleansing of the mirror, the face cannot be seen in it.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗੁ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਨਿਰਮਲਾ ਅਨਹਦ ਧੁਨਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਲਿਵਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jogu Padaarad Niramalaa Anahad Dhouni Andari Liv Laaee.
translation: Yoga is cleansing praxis through which the surati gets absorbed into the unstruck melody.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟਦਸਾ ਸਿਧਿ ਨੳੁ ਨਿਧੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜੋਗੀ ਚਰਨ ਲਗਾੲੀ
transliteration: Asat Dasaa Sidhi Nau Nidhee Guramoukhi Jogee Charan Lagaaee.
translation: Eighteen siddhis and nine treasures fall at the feet of a gurmukh yogi.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਹਿੁ ਜੁਗਾ ਕੀ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਾਤੰਜਲਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Trihu Jougaan Kee Baasanaa Kalijoug Vichi Paatanjali Paaee.
translation: In kaliyug, Patanjali talked about fulfillment of desires that remained unfulfilled in the three ages.

gurmukhi: ਹਥੋ ਹਥੀ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ ਭਗਤਿ ਜੋਗ ਕੀ ਪੂਰ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Hado Hathee Paaeeai Bhagati Jog Kee Poor Kamaaee.
translation: The complete achievement of yogic bhakti is that you every thing hand to hand.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮ ਦਾਨ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਸੁਭਾੲੀ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Naam Daanu Isanaanu Soubhaaee ?14?
translation: The jiv should cultivate the nature of rememberance of God, charity and ablution (internal and external).

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਜੁਗਾਂ ਬਾਬਤ ਪ੍ਰਚਲਿਤ ਖਯਾਲ
translation: Ideas in vogue about the Yugs

gurmukhi: ਜੁਗਿ ਜੁਗਿ ਮੇਰੁ ਸਰੀਰ ਕਾ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਬਧਾ ਅਾਵੈ ਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jougi Jougi Mayru Sareer Kaa Baasanaa Badhaa Aavai Jaavai.
translation: Since time immemorial, on account of the bondage of unfulfilled desires, the jiv has been suffering transmigration.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਫਿਰਿ ਫੇਰਿ ਵਟਾੲੀਅੈ ਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਰਮੁ ਕੳੁ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dhiri Dhiri Dhayri Vataaeeai Giaanee Hoi Maramu Kau Paavai.
translation: Time and again, the body is changed, but the mystery of this change can be understood by becoming knowledgeable.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਰਮੁ ਕਰਿ ਤ੍ਰੇਤੇ ਵਿਚਿ ਜੋਨੀ ਫਿਰ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Satijougi Doojaa Bharamu Kari Traytay Vichi Jonee Dhiri Aavai.
translation: Engrossed in duality in satyug, the jiv entered into the body in treta.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੇਤੇ ਕਰਮਾ ਬਾਂਧਤੇ ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਫਿਰਿ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਕਰਾਵੈ
transliteration: Traytay Karamaan Baandhatay Duaapari Dhiri Avataar Karaavai.
translation: Getting caught in karma-bondage in treta

gurmukhi: ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਮਮਤਾ ਅਹੰਕਾਰ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਗਰਬਿ ਗਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Duaapari Mamataa Ahan Kari Haoumai Andari Garabi Galaavai.
translation: He was born in dvapar and remained writhing and wriggling.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਹਿੁ ਜੁਗਾ ਕੇ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਿ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨ ਸੰਸਾ ਨ ਚੁਕਾਵੈ
transliteration: Trihu Jougaan Kay Karam Kari Janam Maran Sansaa N Choukaavai.
translation: Even the performance of the duties of three ages does not dispel the fear of birth and death.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਦੇਹਿ ਧਰਿ ਕਰਮਾਂ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਫੇਰ ਫਸਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dhiri Kalijoug Andari Dayhi Dhari Karamaan Andari Dhayri Dhasaavai.
translation: The jiv reincarnates in kaliyug and gets entangled in the karmas.

gurmukhi: ਅੳੁਸਰੁ ਚੁਕਾ ਹਥ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Aousaru Choukaa Had N Aavai ?15?
translation: Lost opportunity comes not again.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਤੇ ਨਾਮ
translation: Activities in Kaliyug

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਕੀ ਸੁਣ ਸਾਧਨਾ ਕਰਮ ਕਿਰਤ ਕੀ ਚਲੈ ਨਾ ਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kalijoug Kee Soun Saadhanaa Karam Kirati Kee Chalai N Kaaee.
translation: Now listen to the discipline of kaliyug wherein nobody cares for the rituals.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨਾ ਭਜਨ ਭਗਵਾਨ ਕੇ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਬਿਨ ਠੌਰ ਨਾ ਥਾੲੀ
transliteration: Binaa Bhajan Bhagavaan Kay Bhaau Bhagati Binu Tdaurhi N Paaee.
translation: Without loving devotion none will get any place anywhere.

gurmukhi: ਲਹੇ ਕਮਾਣਾ ੲੇਤ ਜੁਗਿ ਪਿਛਲੀ ਜੁਗੀਂ ਕਰੀ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lahay Kamaanaa Ayt Jougi Pichhalee Jougeen Karee Kamaaee.
translation: Because of the disciplined life in the previous ages, the human form has been obtained in kaliyug.

gurmukhi: ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ਮਾਨਸ ਦੇਹਿ ਕੳੁ ਅੈਥੌ ਚੁਕਿਅਾ ਠੌਰ ਨ ਠਾੲੀ
transliteration: Paaiaa Maanas Dayhi Kau Aidau Choukiaa Tdaur N Tdaaee.
translation: Now if this opportunity slipped, no occasion and place would be made available.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਕੇ ੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਸੁਣਿ ਜੈਸੇ ਬੇਦ ਅਥਰਬਣ ਗਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kalijougi Kay Oupakaari Souni Jaisay Bayd Adaravan Gaaee.
translation: As has been said in the Atharvaveda, listen to the redeeming features of kaliyug.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਪਰਵਾਣ ਹੈ ਜਗ ਹੋਮ ਤੇ ਪੁਰਬ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaau Bhagati Paravaan Hai Jag Hom Gurapurabi Kamaaee.
translation: Now feeingful devotion only is acceptable; yajna, burnt offering and worship of the human guru was the discipline of the earlier ages.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਕੇ ਨੀਚ ਸਦਾਵਣਾ ਤਾ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਲੇਖੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kari Kay Neech Sadaavanaa Taan Prabhu Laykhai Andari Paaee.
translation: If somebody now, in spite of being a doer, erases from his self this sense and prefers to be called lowly, only then he can remain in the good books of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਨਾਵੈ ਕੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Kalijougi Naavai Kee Vadiaaee ?16?
translation: In Kaliyug, only repeating the name of Lord is considered grand.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਜੁਗ ਗਰਦੀ
translation: Anachy of the ages

gurmukhi: ਜੁਗ ਗਰਦੀ ਜਬ ਹੋਵਹੇ ੳੁਲਟੇ ਜੁਗੁ ਕਿਅਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਰਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jougi Garadee Jab Hovahay Ulatay Jougu Kiaa Hoi Varataaraa.
translation: During the down fall of an age, people setting aside the duties of the age bahave contrary to their nature.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੇ ਗਿਲਾਨੀ ਜਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਰਤੇ ਪਾਪ ਭ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਸੰਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Outday Gilaani Jagati Vichi Varatay Paap Bhrisati Sansaaraa.
translation: The world gets engrossed in remorseful activities and sin and corruption prevail.

gurmukhi: ਵਰਨਾਵਰਨ ਨਾ ਭਾਵਨੀ ਖਹਿ ਖਹਿ ਜਲਨ ਬਾਂਸ ਅੰਗਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Varanaavaran N Bhaavanee Khahi Khahi Jalan Baans Angiaaraa.
translation: Different sections(castes) of society develop hatred for one another and finish themselves through squabbles as the bamboos, due to their mutual friction, producing fire burn themselves as well as others.

gurmukhi: ਨਿੰਦਿਅਾ ਚਲੇ ਵੇਦ ਕੀ ਸਮਝਨਿ ਨਹਿ ਅਗਿਅਾਨਿ ਗੁਬਾਰਾ
transliteration: Nidiaa Chalay Vayd Kee Samajhani Nahi Agiaani Goubaaraa.
translation: Condemnation of the knowledge starts and in the darkness of ignorance nothing remains visible.

gurmukhi: ਬੇਦ ਗਿਰੰਥ ਗੁਰ ਹਟਿ ਹੈ ਜਿਸੁ ਲਗਿ ਭਵਜਲ ਪਾਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Bayd Girand Gur Hati Hai Jisu Lagi Bhavajal Paari Outaaraa.
translation: From that knowledge of the Vedas which gets man across the world ocean even the knowledgeable people get away.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਬਾਝੁ ਨ ਬੁਝੀਅੈ ਜਿਚਰੁ ਧਰੇ ਨ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Satigur Baajhu N Bujheeai Jicharu Dharay N Prabhu Avataaraa.
translation: So long God does not descend on earth in the form of true Guru, no mystery can be understood.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਹੈ ਸਚਾ ਸਾਹੁ ਜਗਤੁ ਵਣਜਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gur Paramaysaru Iku Hai Sachaa Saahu Jagatu Banajaaraa.
translation: The Guru and God are one; He is the true master and the whole world craves for Him.

gurmukhi: ਚੜੈ ਸੂਰ ਮਿਟਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਅੰਧਾਰਾ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Charhai Soor Miti Jaai Andhaaraa ?17?
translation: He rises like sun and the darkness is dispelled.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਬੋਧ ਮਤ
translation: Intellectualism

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਬੌਧੁ ਅੳੁਤਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਬੋਧ ਅਬੋਧੁ ਨ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟੀ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kalijougi Bodhu Aoutaaru Hai Bodhu Abodhu N Drisatee Aavai.
translation: In kalijug one finds intellectualism incarnate, but discriminating between knowledge and ignorance is nowhere.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਕਿਸੈ ਵਰਜੲੀ ਸੋੲੀ ਕਰੇ ਜੋੲੀ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Koi N Kisai Varajaee Soee Karay Joee Mani Bhaavai.
translation: Nobody interdicts anybody and everyone is behaving according in his whims.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸੇ ਪੁਜਾੲੀ ਸਿਲਾ ਸੁੰਨਿ ਕੋੲੀ ਗੋਰੀ ਮੜ੍ਹੀ ਪੁਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kisay Pujaaee Silaa Sounni Koee Goree Marhhee Pujaavai.
translation: Someone instructs for the worship of the inert rocks and someone guides people to worship cemetries.

gurmukhi: ਤੰਤ੍ਰ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਖੰਡ ਕਰਿ ਕਲਹਿ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੁ ਬਹੁ ਵਾਦਿ ਵਧਾਵੈ
transliteration: Tantr Mantr Paakhand Kari Kalahi Krodhu Bahu Vaadi Vadhaavai.
translation: Due to the tantra mantra and such hyprocricies, the tensions anger and quarrels have been increased.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੋ ਧਾਪੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਨਿਅਾਰੈ ਨਿਅਾਰੈ ਧਰਮ ਚਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Aapo Dhaapee Hoi Kai Niaaray Niaaray Dharam Chalaavai.
translation: In the rat-race for selfish ends, different religions have been promulgated.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲੀ ਪੂਜੈ ਚੰਦੁ ਸੂਰੁ ਕੋੲੀ ਧਰਤਿ ਅਕਾਸੁ ਮਨਾਵੈ
transliteration: Koee Poojay Chandu Sooru Koee Dharati Akaasu Manaavai.
translation: Someone is woshipping moons, someone sun and someone worshipping earth and sky.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁਣੁ ਪਾਣੀ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੋ ਧਰਮਰਾਜ ਕੋੲੀ ਤ੍ਰਿਪਤਾਵੈ
transliteration: Paounu Paanee Baisantaro Dharam Raaj Koee Tripataavai.
translation: Someone is propitiating air, water, fire and yama the god of death.

gurmukhi: ਫੋਕਟਿ ਧਰਮੀ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾਵੈ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Dhokati Dharamee Bharami Bhulaavai ?18?
translation: These all are religious hypocrities and are tossing in delusions.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਭਿੱਖੂ ਨਿਰਣਯ
translation: Of garbs and guises

gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ਗਿਲਾਨਿ ਜਗਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਅਾਸ੍ਰਮ ੳੁਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Bhaee Gilaani Jagatri Vichi Chaari Varani Aasram Oupaaay.
translation: In view of the prevaling lassitude in the world, four varnas and four Ashrams were established.

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਨਾਮਿ ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸੀਅਾ ਜੋਗੀ ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥਿ ਚਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Dasi Naami Sanniaaseeaa Jogee Baarah Panthi Chalaaay.
translation: Then ten orders of ascetics and twelve orders Of yogis came into being.

gurmukhi: ਜੰਗਮ ਅਤੇ ਸਰੇਵੜੇ ਦਗੇ ਦਿਗੰਬਰਿ ਵਾਦਿ ਕਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jangam Atay Sarayvarhay Dagay Diganbari Vaadi Karaaay.
translation: Further jangams, the wanderers, sramans and Digambrs, naked jain ascetics also started their disputations.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਣਿ ਬਹੁ ਪਰਕਾਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰਿ ਵੇਦ ਪੁਰਾਣਿ ਲੜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Brahamani Bahu Parakaari Kari Saasatri Vayd Puraani Larhaaay.
translation: Many Categories of brahmins came into being who propounded Shastras, Vedas and Purans contradicting one another.

gurmukhi: ਖਟਿ ਦਰਸਨ ਬਹੁ ਵੈਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਨਾਲਿ ਛਤੀਸਿ ਪਖੰਡ ਰਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Kharhu Darasan Bahu Vairi Kari Naali Chhateesi Pakhand Ralaaay.
translation: The mutual irreconcilability of the six Indian philosophies further added many hypocrisies.

gurmukhi: ਤੰਤ ਮੰਤ ਰਾਸਾੲਿਣਾ ਕਰਾਮਾਤਿ ਕਾਲਖਿ ਲਪਟਾੲੇ
transliteration: Tant Mant Raasaainaa Karaamaati Kaalakhi Lapataaay.
translation: Alchemy, tantra,  mantra and miracles became everything for people.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਸਿ ਤੇ ਬਹੁ ਰੂਪਿ ਕਰਿ ਰੂਪ ਕਰੂਪੀ ਘਣੇ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ
transliteration: Ikasi Tay Bahu Roopi Kari Roopi Kuroopee Ghanay Dikhaaay.
translation: By getting divided into myriad sects(and castes) they produced a horrible look.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾੲੇ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Kalijougi Andari Bharami Bhulaaay ?19?
translation: They all were deluded by kaliyug.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨੀ ਮਤ
translation: Islam

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਵਾਟੀ ਜਗਿ ਚਲੀਅਾ ਤਬ ਹੀ ਭੲੇ ਮੁਹੰਮਦਿ ਯਾਰਾ
transliteration: Bahu Vaatee Jagi Chaleeaa Tab Hee Bhaay Muhanmadi Yaaraa.
translation: When varied sects got prevalent, then Muhammad, the beloved of God was born.

gurmukhi: ਕੳੁਮਿ ਬਹਤਰਿ ਸੰਗਿ ਕਰਿ ਬਹੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਵੈਰੁ ਵਿਰੋਧੁ ਪਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kaoumi Bahatari Sangi Kari Bahu Bidhi Vairu Virodh Pasaaraa.
translation: The nation got divided into seventy two divisions and many types of enmity and opposition erupted.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਜੇ ੲੀਦ ਨਿਮਾਜਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਮੀ ਬੰਦਿ ਕੀਅਾ ਸੰਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Rojay Eed Nimaaji Kari Karamee Bandi Keeaa Sansaaraa.
translation: The world was bound to roza, id, namaz, etc.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਪੈਕੰਬਰ ਅੳੁਲੀੲੇ ਗੳੁਸ ਕੁਤਬ ਬਹੁ ਭੇਖ ਸਵਾਰਾ
transliteration: Peer Paikanbari Auleeay Gaousi Koutab Bahu Bhaykh Savaaraa.
translation: Pirs, paigambars aulias, gaus and qutabs came into being in many countries.

gurmukhi: ਠਾਕੁਰ ਦੁਅਾਰੇ ਢਾਹਿਕੈ ਤਿਹਿ ਠੳੁੜੀ ਮਾਸੀਤ ੳੁਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Tdaakur Duaaray Ddhaahi Kai Tihi Tdaurhee Maaseeti Ousaaraa.
translation: The temples were replaced by mosques.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਰਨਿ ਗੳੂ ਗਰੀਬ ਨੋ ਧਰਤੀ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਪਾਪੁ ਬਿਥਾਰਾ
transliteration: Maarani Gaoo Gareeb No Dharatee Oupari Paapu Bidaaraa.
translation: Less powerful were killed and thus the earth became replete with sin.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਫਰ ਮੁਲਹਦ ੲਿਰਮਨੀ ਰੂਮੀ ਜੰਗੀ ਦੁਸਮਣਿ ਦਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kaadhari Mulahadi Iramanee Roomee Jangee Dousamani Daaraa.
translation: Armenians and Rumis were declared apostates (Kafirs) and they were decimated in the Battle fields.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਪੇ ਦਾ ਵਰਤਿਅਾ ਵਰਤਾਰਾ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Paapay Daa Varatiaa Varataaraa ?20?
translation: The sin became ubiquitious all around.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨ ਦਾ ਟਾਕਰਾ
translation: Clash between Hindu and Muslim

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਚਾਰਿ ਮਜਹਬਾ ਜਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣੇ
transliteration: Chaari Varani Chaari Majahabaan Jagi Vichi Hindoo Mousalamaanay.
translation: There are four castes of Hindus and four sects of Muslims in the world.

gurmukhi: ਖੁਦੀ ਬਖੀਲਿ ਤਕਬਰੀ ਖਿੰਚੋਤਾਣ ਕਰੇਨਿ ਧਿਙਾਣੇ
transliteration: Khudee Bakheeli Takabaree Khinchotaani Karayni Dhiaanay.
translation: The members of both religions are selfish, jealous proud, bigoted and violent.

gurmukhi: ਗੰਗ ਬਨਾਰਸਿ ਹਿੰਦੂਅਾਂ ਮਕਾ ਕਾਬਾ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣੇ
transliteration: Gang Banaarasi Hindooaan Makaa Kaabaa Mousalamaanay.
translation: The Hindus make pilgrimage to Hardvar and Banaras, the Muslim to the Kaba of Mecca.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਨਤਿ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣ ਦੀ ਤਿਲਕ ਜੰਞਞਞਞੂ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਲੋਭਾਣੇ
transliteration: Sounnati Mousalamaan Dee Tilak Joon Hindoo Lobhaanay.
translation: Circumcision is dear to the Muslims, sandal mark (tilak) and sacred thread to the Hindus.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਰਹੀਮ ਕਹਾੲਿਦੇ ੲਿਕੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਦੁੲਿ ਰਾਹ ਭੁਲਾਣੇ
transliteration: Raam Raheem Kahaaiday Iku Naamu Dui Raah Bhulaanay.
translation: The Hindus invoke Ram, the Muslims, Rahim, but in reality there is only One God.

gurmukhi: ਬੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਭੁਲਾੲਿਕੈ ਮੋਹੇ ਲਾਲਚ ਦੁਨੀ ਸੈਤਾਣੇ
transliteration: Bayd Katayb Bhulaai Kai Mohay Laalach Dounee Saitaanay.
translation: Since they have forgotten the Vedas and the Katebas, worldly greed and devil have led them astray.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਕਿਨਾਰੇ ਰਹਿ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਖਹਿ ਮਰਦੇ ਬਾਹਮਣ ਮੳੁਲਾਣੇ
transliteration: Sachu Kinaaray Rahi Giaa Khahi Maraday Baamhani Maulaanay.
translation: Truth hidden from both; the brahmins and maulvis kill one another by their animosities.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰੋ ਨ ਮਿਟੇ ਅਾਵਣ ਜਾਣੇ ॥੨੧॥
transliteration: Siro N Mitay Aavani Jaanay ?21?
translation: Neither sect shall find liberation from transmigration.

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਜੀ ਦਾ ਨਿਅਾੳੁਂ
translation: Justice of Waheguru,God

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰੇ ਜਾਗੇ ਚਹੁ ਜੁਗੀ ਪੰਚਾੲਿਣੁ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਅਾਪੇ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Chaaray Jaagay Chahu Jougee Panchaainu Prabhu Aapay Hoaa.
translation: God himself is the justice for the disputes about the duties of the four Ages.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੇ ਪਟੀ ਕਲਮਿ ਅਾਪਿ ਅਾਪੇ ਲਿਖਣਿਹਾਰਾ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Aapay Patee Kalami Aapi Aapay Likhanihaaraa Hoaa.
translation: He himself id the paper, the pen and the scribe.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਝੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਅੰਧੇਰੁ ਹੈ ਖਹਿ ਖਹਿ ਮਰਦੇ ਬਹੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Baajhu Guroo Andhayru Hai Khahi Khahi Maraday Bahu Bidhi Loaa.
translation: Without Guru is all darkness and people are killing one another.

gurmukhi: ਵਰਤਿਅਾ ਪਾਪੁ ਜਗਤ੍ਰ ਤੇ ਧੳੁਲ ੳੁਡੀਣਾ ਨਿਸਿਦਿਨ ਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Varatiaa Paapu Jagatri Tay Dhaulu Udeenaa Nisidini Roaa.
translation: The sin pervades all around and the (mythological) ox supporting the earth is weeping and wailing day and night.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਝੁ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਬਲਹੀਣ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਘਰ ਚਲੇ ਰਸਾਤਲਿ ਟੋਅਾ
transliteration: Baajhu Daiaa Balaheen Hou Nigharu Chalau Rasaatali Toaa.
translation: Without compassion, getting unnerved, it is descending towards nether world to get lost.

gurmukhi: ਖੜਾ ੲਿਕਤੇ ਪੈਰ ਤੇ ਪਾਪਾ ਸੰਗਿ ਬਹੁ ਭਾਰਾ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Kharhaa Ikatay Pairi Tay Paap Sangi Bahu Bhaaraa Hoaa.
translation: Standing on one foot, it is feeling the load of sins.

gurmukhi: ਥੰਮੇ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਸਾਧੁ ਬਿਨੁ ਸਾਧੁ ਨ ਦਿਸੈ ਜਗਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਕੋਅਾ
transliteration: Danmay Koi N Saadhu Bin Saadhu N Disai Jagi Vich Koaa.
translation: Now this earth cannot be upheld without the saints and no saint is available in the world.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਮ ਧੳੁਲ ਪੁਕਾਰੇ ਤਲੈ ਖੜੋਅਾ ॥੨੨॥
transliteration: Dharam Dhaulu Poukaarai Talai Kharhoaa ?22?
translation: Religion in the form of ox is crying beneath.

gurmukhi: ੨੩ ਗੁਰ ਅਵਤਾਰ
translation: Coming of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣੀ ਪੁਕਾਰਿ ਦਾਤਾਰ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਨਾਨਕ ਜਗ ਮਾਹਿ ਪਠਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sounee Poukaari Daataar Prabhu Guru Naanak Jag Maahi Patdaaiaa.
translation: The benefactor Lord listened to the cries (of humanity) and sent Guru Nanak to this world.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਧੋੲਿ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰਿ ਚਰਣਾਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਸਿਖਾਂ ਪੀਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charan Dhoi Raharaasi Kari Charanaamritu Sikhaan Peelaaiaa.
translation: He washed His feet, eulogised God and got his Disciples drink the ambrosia of his feet.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਅੰਦਰਿ ੲਿਕ ਦਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Kalijougi Andari Iku Dikhaaiaa.
translation: He preached in this darkage (kaliyug) that, saragun (Brahm) and nirgun (Parbrahm) are the same and identical.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰੇ ਪੈਰ ਧਰਮ ਦੇ ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ੲਿਕ ਵਰਨੁ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chaaray Pair Dharam Day Chaari Varani Iku Varanu Karaaiaa.
translation: Dharma was now established on its four feet and all the four castes (through fraternal feeling) were converted into one caste (of  humanity).

gurmukhi: ਰਾਣਾ ਰੰਕ ਬਰਾਬਰੀ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਵਣਾ ਜਗਿ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Raanaa Ranku Baraabaree Pairee Paavanaa Jagi Varataaiaa.
translation: Equating the poor with the prince, he spread the etiquette of humbly touching the feet.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲਟਾ ਖੇਲੁ ਪਿਰੰਮ ਦਾ ਪੈਰਾ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਸੀਸੁ ਨਿਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ulataa Khaylu Piranm Daa Pairaa Oupari Seesu Nivaaiaa.
translation: Inverse is the game of the beloved; he got the egotist high heads bowed to feet.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਬਾਬੇ ਤਾਰਿਅਾ ਸਤਿਨਾਮੁ ਪੜ੍ਹਿ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kalijougu Baabay Taariaa Satinaamu Parhhi Mantr Sounaaiaa.
translation: Baba Nanak rescued this dark age (kaliyug) and recited ‘satinam’ mantr for one and all.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿ ਤਾਰਣ ਗੁਰੁ ਨਾਨਕ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੨੩॥
transliteration: Kali Taarani Guru Naanaku Aaiaa ?23?
translation: Guru Nanak came to redeem the kaliyug.

gurmukhi: ੨੪ ਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇਵ ਜੀ ਦਾ ਪਹਿਲਾ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਗ
translation: First episode of Guru Nanak Dev ji

gurmukhi: ਪਹਿਲਾ ਬਾਬੇ ਪਾਯਾ ਬਖਸੁ ਦਰਿ ਪਿਛੋ ਦੇ ਫਿਰਿ ਘਾਲਿ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pahilaa Baabay Paayaa Bakhasu Dari Pichhoday Dhiri Ghaali Kamaaee.
translation: First of all Baba Nanak obtained the gate of the grace (of Lord) and then He underwent and earned the rigorous discipline( of heart and mind).

gurmukhi: ਰੇਤੁ ਅਕੁ ਅਾਹਾਰੁ ਕਰਿ ਰੋੜਾ ਕੀ ਗੁਰ ਕਰੀ ਵਿਛਾੲੀ
transliteration: Raytu Aku Aahaaru Kari Rorhaa Kee Gur Keea Vichhaaee.
translation: He fed himself with sand and swallow-wort and made stones his bedding i.e. he enjoyed poverty too.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਰੀ ਕਰੀ ਤਪਸਿਅਾ ਵਡੇ ਭਾਗੁ ਹਰਿ ਸਿੳੁ ਬਣਿ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaaree Karee Tapasiaa Vaday Bhaagi Hari Siu Bani Aaee.
translation: He offered hid full devotion and then he was fortunate to have proximity with God.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਪੈਧਾ ਸਚਖੰਡਿ ਨੳੁ ਨਿਧਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਗਰੀਬੀ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Paidhaa Sachi Khandi Nau Nidhi Naamu Gareebee Paaee.
translation: Baba reached the region of truth wherefrom he received Nam, the storehouse of nine treasures and  humility.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਦੇਖੈ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਧਰਿ ਜਲਤੀ ਸਭਿ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਵੀ ਦਿਸਿ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Daykhai Dhiaanu Dhari Jalatee Sabhi Pridavee Disi Aaee.
translation: In his meditation, Baba found the whole earth burning (with the fire of lust and anger).

gurmukhi: ਬਾਝਹੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਗੁਬਾਰ ਹੈ ਹੈ ਹੈ ਕਰਦੀ ਸੁਣੀ ਲੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baajhu Guroo Goubaaru Hai Hai Hai Karadee Sounee Loukaaee.
translation: Without Guru there is utter darkness and he heard the cries of the common men.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬੇ ਭੇਖ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ ਕੀ ਰੀਤਿ ਚਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabay Bhaykh Banaaiaa Udaasee Kee Reeti Chalaaee.
translation: To further understand the people, Guru Nanak donned robes in their manner and preached them to be detached (from the pleasure and pain).

gurmukhi: ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅਾ ਸੋਧਣਿ ਧਰਤਿ ਲੁਕਾੲੀ ॥੨੪॥
transliteration: Charhhiaa Sodhani Dharati Loukaaee ?24?
translation: Thus he went out to depurate humanity on earth.

gurmukhi: ੨੫ ਤੀਰਥਾਂ ਪਰ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਦੀ ਸੁੰਞਞਞਞ
translation: Lack of love and affection at pilgrim centres

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਤੀਰਥੈ ਤੀਰਥ ਪੁਰਬ ਸਭੇ ਫਿਰਿ ਦੇਖੈ
transliteration: Baabaa Aaiaa Teeradai Teeradi Purabi Sabhay Dhiri Daykhai.
translation: Baba (Nanak) came to the pilgrimage centres and by participating in the ceremonies there he observed them minutely.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਬ ਧਰਮ ਬਹੁ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਿ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਕਿਤੇ ਨ ਲੇਖੈ
transliteration: Purab Dharami Bahu Karami Kari Bhaau Bhagati Binu Kitai N Laykhai.
translation: People were busy in performing the rituals of the ceremonies but since being bereft of loving devotion, they were of no avail.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੁ ਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੈ ਲਿਖਿਅਾ ਚਾਰਿ ਬੇਦਿ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਪੜ੍ਹਿ ਪੇਖੈ
transliteration: Bhaau N Brahamai Likhiaa Chaari Bayd Sinmriti Parhhi Paykhai.
translation: Having gone through the Vedas and simritis one finds that Brhama also has nowhere written about the Sentiment of love.

gurmukhi: ਢੂੰਡੀ ਸਗਲੀ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਵੀ ਸਤਿਜੁਗਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਤ੍ਰੇਤੈ
transliteration: Ddhoondee Sagalee Pridavee Satijougi Aadi Duaapari Traytai.
translation: To find out the same, the satyug, treta dvapar etc. have been screened.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਧੰਧੂਕਾਰ ਹੈ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾੲੀ ਬਹੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਭੇਖੈ
transliteration: Kalijougi Dhoundhookaaru Hai Bharami Bhulaaee Bahu Bidhi Bhaykhai.
translation: In kaliyug, the pitch darkness prevails in which many guises and hypocritical ways have been started.

gurmukhi: ਭੇਖੀ ਪ੍ਰਭੂ ਨ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੇ ਰੂਪ ਨ ਰੇਖੈ
transliteration: Bhaykhee Prabhoo N Paaeeai Aapu Gavaaay Roop N Raykhai.
translation: Through garbs and guises one cannot reach the Lord; He can be reached through self-effacement.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਰਨੁ ਅਵਰਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਵ ਚਲਣਾ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਿ ਵਿਸੇਖੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Varanu Avaranu Hoi Nivi Chalanaa Gurasikhi Visaykhai.
translation: The special feature of the Sikh of the Guru is that he goes beyond the framework of caste-classification and moves in humility.

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕਛੁ ਘਾਲਿ ਪਵੈ ਦਰਿ ਲੇਖੈ ॥੨੫॥
transliteration: Taa Kichhu Ghaali Pavai Dari Laykhai ?25?
translation: Then his toilsome labour becomes acceptable at the door (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ੨੬ ੳੁਸ ਸਮੇਂ ਦੇ ਹਾਲਾਤ
translation: Erstwhile condition

gurmukhi: ਜਤੀ ਸਤੀ ਚਿਰੁਜੀਵਣੇ ਸਾਧਿਕ ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲੇ
transliteration: Jatee Satee Chirujeevanay Saadhik Sidh Naad Guru Chaylay.
translation: Celebates, ascetics, immortal anchorites, the siddhs, naths and teacher- taughts were available in abundance.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਰਿਖੀਸੁਰਾ ਭੈਰੳੁ ਖੇਤ੍ਰਪਾਲਿ ਬਹੁ ਮੇਲੇ
transliteration: Dayvee Dayv Rikheesuraa Bhairau Khaytrapaali Bahu Maylay.
translation: Many varieties of gods, goddesses, munis, bhairavs and other protectors were there.

gurmukhi: ਗਣ ਗੰਧਰਬ ਅਪਸਰਾ ਕਿੰਨਰ ਜਖ ਚਲਿਤਿ ਬਹੁ ਖੇਲੇ
transliteration: Gan Gandharab Apasaraa Kinnar Jakh Chaliti Bahu Khaylay.
translation: In the name of ganas, gandharvs, fairies, kinnars and yaksas, many dragnets and dramas were enacted.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਕਸਿ ਦਾਨੋ ਦੈਤ ਲਖ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਦੁਹੇਲੇ
transliteration: Raakasi Daano Dait Lakhi Andari Doojaa Bhaau Duhaylay.
translation: Seeing raksasas, demons, daitys in their imagination, people were totally in the clutches of duality.

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁਮੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਭਿ ਕੋ ਡੁਬੇ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਣੇ ਬਹੁ ਚੇਲੇ
transliteration: Haoumai Andari Sabhi Ko Doubay Guroo Sanay Bahu Chaylay.
translation: All were engrossed with ego and the taughts were getting drowned alongwith their teachers.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਦਿਸੲੀ ਢੂੰਡੇ ਤੀਰਥਿ ਜਾਤ੍ਰੀ ਮੇਲੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Koee N Disaee Ddhoonday Teeradi Jaatree Maylay.
translation: Even after minute research, the guru-oriented were nowhere to be found.

gurmukhi: ਡਿਠੇ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਤੁਰਕਿ ਸਭਿ ਪੀਰ ਪੈਕੰਬਰਿ ਕੳੁਮਿ ਕਤੇਲੇ
transliteration: Ditday Hindoo Turaki Sabhi Peer Paikanbari Kaoumi Kataylay.
translation: All the sects, pirs, paigambars of the Hindus and Muslims were seen (by Baba Nanak).

gurmukhi: ਅੰਧੀ ਅੰਧੇ ਖੂਹੇ ਠੇਲੇ ॥੨੬॥
transliteration: Andhee Andhay Khoohay Tdaylay ?26?
translation: Blinds were pushing the blinds into well.

gurmukhi: ੨੭ ਗੁਰੂ ਸੂਰਯੋਦਯ
translation: Rise of Guru Nanak

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਪ੍ਰਗਟਿਅਾ ਮਿਟੀ ਧੁੰਧੁ ਜਗਿ ਚਾਨਣੁ ਹੋਅਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Naanaku Pragatiaa Mitee Dhoundhu Jagi Chaananu Hoaa.
translation: With the emergence of the true Guru Nanak, the mist cleared and the light scattered all around.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਨਿਕਲਿਅਾ ਤਾਰੇ ਛਪਿ ਅੰਧੇਰੁ ਪਲੋਅਾ
transliteration: Jiu Kari Sooraju Nikaliaa Taaray Chhipay Andhayru Paloaa.
translation: As if at the sun rise the stars disappeared and the darkness dispelled.

gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਘ ਬੁਕੇ ਮਿਰਗਾਵਲੀ ਭੰਨੀ ਜਾੲਿ ਨ ਧੀਰਿ ਧਰੋਅਾ
transliteration: Singhu Boukay Miragaavalee Bhannee Jaai N Dheeri Dharoaa.
translation: With the roar of the lion in the forest the flocks of escaping deer now cannot have endurance.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਥੇ ਬਾਬਾ ਪੈਰ ਧਰਿ ਪੂਜਾ ਅਾਸਣੁ ਥਾਪਣਿ ਸੋਅਾ
transliteration: Jiday Baabaa Pairu Dharay Poojaa Aasanu Daapani Soaa.
translation: Wherever Baba put his feet, a religious place was erected and established.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਅਾਸਣਿ ਸਭਿ ਜਗਤ ਦੇ ਨਾਨਕ ਅਾਦਿ ਮਤੇ ਜੇ ਕੋਅਾ
transliteration: Sidhaasani Sabhi Jagati Day Naanak Aadi Matay Jay Koaa.
translation: All the siddh-places now have been renamed on the name of Nanak.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਹੋਵੈ ਕੀਰਤਨੁ ਸਦਾ ਵਿਸੋਅਾ
transliteration: Ghari Ghari Andari Dharamasaal Hovai Keeratanu Sadaa Visoaa.
translation: Everyhome has become a place of dharma where singing.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬੇ ਤਾਰੇ ਚਾਰਿ ਚਕਿ ਨੳੁ ਖੰਡਿ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮੀ ਸਚਾ ਢੋਅਾ
transliteration: Baabay Taaray Chaari Chaki Nau Khandi Pridavee Sachaa Ddhoaa.
translation: Baba liberated all four directions and nine divisions of earth.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਖਿ ਕਲਿ ਵਿਚ ਪਰਗਟੁ ਹੋਅਾ ॥੨੭॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Kali Vichi Paragatu Hoaa?27?
translation: Gurmukh (Guru Nanak) has emerged in this kaliyug, the dark age.

gurmukhi: ੨੮ ਸੁਮੇਰੁ ਜਾਣਾ
translation: Journey to Summer mountain

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬੇ ਡਿਠੀ ਪਿਰਥਮੀ ਨਵੈ ਖੰਡਿ ਜਿਥੈ ਤਕਿ ਅਾਹੀ
transliteration: Baabay Ditdee Piradamee Navai Khandi Jidai Taki Aahee.
translation: Baba Nanak visualized all the expansive nine divisions of the earth.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅਾ ਸੁਮੇਰ ਪਰ ਸਿਧ ਮੰਡਲੀ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟੀ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dhiri Jaai Charhhiaa Soumayr Pari Sidhi Mandalee Drisatee Aaee.
translation: Then he climbed up to the Sumer mountain where he came across a group of  siddhs.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀਹ ਸਿਧ ਗੋਰਖਾਦਿ ਮਨ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਗਣਤੀ ਵਰਤਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chauraaseeh Sidhi Gorakhaadi Man Andari Ganatee Varataaee.
translation: The mind of the eighty four siddhs and Gorakh filled with  surprise and doubts.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਪੁਛਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਬਾਲਿਅਾ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਸਕਤਿ ਤੁਹਿ ੲੇਥੇ ਲਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sidhi Pouchhani Souni Baaliaa Kaounu Sakati Tuhi Ayday Liaaee.
translation: Siddhas asked (Guru Nanak), (O young boy! Which power brought you here?)

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁ ਜਪਿਅਾ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੋ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਸੰਗਿ ਤਾੜੀ ਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Hau Japiaa Paramaysaro Bhaau Bhagati Sangi Taarhee Laaee.
translation: Guru Nanak replied that for coming to this place (I have remembered the Lord with loving devotion and meditated upon Him deeply.)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਖਣਿ ਸਿਧ ਸੁਣਿ ਬਾਲਿਅਾ ਅਾਪਣਾ ਨਾੳੁ ਤੁਮ ਦੇਹੁ ਬਤਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aakhani Sidhi Souni Baaliaa Apanaa Naau Toum Dayhu Bataaee.
translation: Siddhs said, (O young man, tell us your name).

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਅਾਖੇ ਨਾਥ ਜੀ ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮ ਜਪੇ ਗਤਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Aakhay Naad Jee Naanak Naam Japay Gati Paaee.
translation: Baba replied, (O respected Nath! This Nanak has attained this position through rememberance of the name of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਨੀਚੁ ਕਹਾੲਿ ੳੂਚ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲੀ ॥੨੮॥
transliteration: Neechu Kahaai Ooch Ghari Aaee ?28?
translation: By calling himself lowly, one attains the high position.

gurmukhi: ੨੯ ਸਿੱਧਾਂ ਨਾਲ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨੋਤ੍ਰ
translation: Discussion with the Siddhs

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਪੁਛਣਿ ਸਿਧ ਨਾਨਕਾ ਮਾਤ ਲੋਕ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਿਅਾ ਵਰਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Dhiri Pouchhani Sidh Naanakaa Maat Lok Vichi Kiaa Varataaraa.
translation: Siddhs again asked, (O Nanak! How are the dealings on mother earth?).

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਸਿਧੀ ੲਿਹ ਬੁਝਿਅਾ ਕਲਿ ਤਾਰਣਿ ਨਾਨਕ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sabh Sidhee Ih Bujhiaa Kali Taarani Naanak Avataaraa.
translation: By this time all the siddhs understood that Nanak had come to earth to deliver it from the (sins of) kaliyug.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬੇ ਅਾਖਿਅਾ ਨਾਥ ਜੀ ਸਚੁ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮਾਂ ਕੂੜੁ ਅੰਧਾਰਾ
transliteration: Baabay Aakhiaa Naad Jee Sachu Chandramaa Koorhu Andhaaraa.
translation: Baba replied, (O respected Nath, the truth is dim like the moon and the falsehood like deep darkness).

gurmukhi: ਕੂੜੁ ਅਮਾਵਸਿ ਵਰਤਿਅਾ ਹੳੁ ਭਾਲਣਿ ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅਾ ਸੰਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Koorhu Amaavasi Varatiaa Hau Bhaalani Charhhiaa Sansaaraa.
translation: The darkness of the moonless night of the falsehood has spread around and I, in order to search for the (truthful) world, have undertaken this journey.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਪ ਗਿਰਾਸੀ ਪਿਰਥਮੀ ਧੳੁਲੁ ਖੜਾ ਧਰਿ ਹੇਠ ਪੁਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Paapi Giraasee Piradamee Dhaulu Kharhaa Dhari Haytd Poukaaraa.
translation: The earth is engrossed with sin and its support, the dharma in the form of ox is crying and wailing (for rescue).

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਛਪਿ ਬੈਠੇ ਪਰਬਤੀ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਜਗਤ੍ਰਿ ਕੳੁ ਪਾਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sidh Chhapi Baitday Parabatee Kaounu Jagati Kau Paari Outaaraa.
translation: In such circumstances, when siddhs, the adepts, by (becoming repudiators) have taken refuge in the  mountains, how the world could get redeemed.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗੀ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਵਿਹੂਣਿਅਾ ਨਿਸਦਿਨ ਅੰਗਿ ਲਗਾੲਿਨਿ ਛਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jogee Giaan Vihooniaa Nisadini Angi Lagaaay Chhaaraa.
translation: Yogis also bereft of knowledge and simply applying ashes to their bodies are lying down unconcerned.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਝੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਡੁਬਾ ਜਗੁ ਸਾਰਾ ॥੨੯॥
transliteration: Baajhu Guroo Doubaa Jagu Saaraa ?29?
translation: Without Guru the world is getting drowned.

gurmukhi: ੩੦ ਭਾਰਤ ਦੀ ਦੁਰਦਸ਼ਾ
translation: Miserable plight of India

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿ ਅਾੲੀ ਕੁਤੇ ਮੁਹੀ ਖਾਜੁ ਹੋੲਿਅਾ ਮੁਰਦਾਰ ਗੁਸਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kali Aaee Koutay Muhee Khaaju Hoiaa Muradaar Gousaaee.
translation: O God! in kaliyug , the mentality of the jiv has become like the mouth of dog which always seeks the dead to eat.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੇ ਪਾਪ ਕਮਾਵਦੇ ੳੁਲਟੀ ਵਾੜ ਖੇਤ ਕੳੁ ਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Raajay Paapu Kamaanvaday Ulatee Vaarh Khayt Kau Khaaee.
translation: The kings are sinning as if the protective fence were itself devouring the (crop in the) field.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਜਾ ਅੰਧੀ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਬਿਨੁ ਕੂੜੁ ਕੁਸਤਿ ਮੁਖਹੁ ਅਾਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Parajaa Andhee Giaan Binu Koorh Kousatu Moukhahu Aalaaee.
translation: Bereft of knowledge, the blind people are uttering falsehood.

gurmukhi: ਚੇਲੇ ਸਾਜ ਵਜਾੲਿਦੇ ਨਚਨਿ ਗੁਰੂ ਬਹੁਤੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chaylay Saaj Vajaaiday Nachani Guroo Bahoutu Bidhi Bhaaee.
translation: Now the gurus are dancing variously to the tunes played by the disciples.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਵਕ ਬੈਠਨਿ ਘਰਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਠਿ ਘਰੀ ਤਿਨਾੜੇ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chaylay Baitdani Gharaan Vichi Guru Outdi Ghareen Tinaarhay Jaaee.
translation: The taughts now sit at home and the teachers go their abodes.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਜੀ ਹੋੲੇ ਰਿਸਵਤੀ ਵਢੀ ਲੈ ਕੈ ਹਕ ਗਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kaajee Hoay Risavatee Vaddhee Lai Kai Haku Gavaaee.
translation: Qazis enjoy bribes and getting the same they have lost their high regards and position.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਸਤ੍ਰੀ ਪੁਰਖੈ ਦਾਮ ਹਿਤੁ ਭਾਵੈ ਅਾੲਿ ਕਿਥਾੳੂ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Isatree Purakhay Daami Hitu Bhaavai Aai Kidaaoon Jaaee.
translation: Man and woman love each other for riches, may they come from anywhere.

gurmukhi: ਵਰਤਿਅਾ ਪਾਪ ਸਭਸ ਜਗ ਮਾਂਹੀ ॥੩੦॥
transliteration: Varatiaa Paapu Sabhasi Jagi Maanhee ?30?
translation: The sin has become ubiquitous in the whole world.

gurmukhi: ੩੧ ਗੁਰੂ ਪ੍ਰੀਖਿਅਾ
translation: Testing the Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧੀ ਮਨੇ ਬੀਚਾਰਿਅਾ ਕਿਵੈ ਦਰਸਨ ੲੇ ਲੇਵੈ ਬਾਲਾ
transliteration: Sidhee Manay Beechaariaa Kivai Darasanu Ay Layvai Baalaa.
translation: The siddhs thought in their mind that this body should in all circumstances Adopt philosophy of yoga.

gurmukhi: ਅੈਸਾ ਜੋਗੀ ਕਲੀ ਮਹਿ ਹਮਰੇ ਪੰਥ ਕਰੇ ੳੁਜਿਅਾਲਾ
transliteration: Aisaa Jogee Kalee Mahi Hamaray Pandu Karay Ujiaalaa.
translation: Such a yogi in kaliyug, will brighten the name of our sect.

gurmukhi: ਖਪਰ ਦਿਤਾ ਨਾਥ ਜੀ ਪਾਣੀ ਭਰਿ ਲੈਵਣਿ ੳੁਠਿ ਚਾਲਾ
transliteration: Khaparu Ditaa Naad Jee Paanee Bhari Laivani Outdi Chaalaa.
translation: One of the Naths, gave him a begging bowl to fetch water.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਪਾਣੀਅੈ ਡਿਠੇ ਰਤਨ ਜਵਾਹਰ ਲਾਲਾ
transliteration: Baabaa Aaiaa Paaneeai Ditday Ratan Javaahar Laalaa.
translation: When Baba came to the stream for water, he saw rubies and jewels in it.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਅਗਮ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਕੇਹੜਾ ਝਲੇ ਗੁਰੂ ਦੀ ਝਾਲਾ
transliteration: Satigur Agam Agaadhi Purakhu Kayharhaa Jhalay Guroo Dee Jhaalaa.
translation: This true Guru (Nanak) was unfathomable supreme purusa and who could  bear with his effulgence.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਗੁਰ ਨਾਥ ਜੀ ਪਾਣੀ ਠੳੁੜ ਨਹੀ ੳੁਸਿ ਤਾਲਾ
transliteration: Dhiri Aaiaa Gur Naad Jee Paanee Tdaurh Naahee Ousi Taalaa.
translation: He (remaining uninfluenced) returned to the  group and said, O Nath, in that stream there is no water.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦਿ ਜਿਤੀ ਸਿਧਿ ਮੰਡਲੀ ਕੀਤੋਸੁ ਅਪਣਾ ਪੰਥੁ ਨਿਰਾਲਾ
transliteration: Sabadi Jitee Sidhi Mandalee Keetosu Apanaa Pandu Niraalaa.
translation: Through (the power of the word) Shabad he conquered the siddhs and propounded his altogether new way of life.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮ ਸੁਖਾਲਾ ॥੩੧॥
transliteration: Kalijougi Naanak Naamu Soukhaalaa ?31?
translation: In Kaliyug, instead of yogic exercises the name of the Lord who is beyond all sufferings (Nanak) is the only source of delight.

gurmukhi: ੩੨ ਮੱਕੇ ਦੀ ਯਾਤ੍ਰਾ
translation: At Mecca

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਫਿਰਿ ਮਕੇ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਨੀਲ ਬਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੇ ਬਨਵਾਰੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Dhiri Makay Gaiaa Neel Basatr Dhaaray Banavaaree.
translation: Donning blue attire then Baba Nanak went to Mecca.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸਾ ਹਥਿ ਕਿਤਾਬ ਕਛਿ ਕੂਜਾ ਬਾਂਗ ਮੁਸਲਾ ਧਾਰੀ
transliteration: Aasaa Hadi Kitaab Kachhi Koojaa Baang Mousalaa Dhaaree.
translation: He held staff in his hand, pressed a book under his armpit, caught hold of a metal pot and mattress.

gurmukhi: ਬੈਠਾ ਜਾੲਿ ਮਸੀਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਿਥੈ ਹਾਜੀ ਹਜਿ ਗੁਜਾਰੀ
transliteration: Baitdaa Jaai Maseet Vichi Jidai Haajee Haji Gujaaree.
translation: Now he sat in a mosque where the pilgrms (hajis) had gathered.

gurmukhi: ਜਾ ਬਾਬਾ ਸੁਤਾ ਰਾਤਿ ਨੋ ਵਲਿ ਮਹਰਾਬੇ ਪਾੲਿ ਪਸਾਰੀ
transliteration: Jaa Baabaa Soutaa Raati No Vali Maharaabay Paai Pasaaree.
translation: When Baba (Nanak) slept in the night spreading his legs towards the alcove of mosque at Kaba,

gurmukhi: ਜੀਵਣਿ ਮਾਰੀ ਲਤਿ ਦੀ ਕੇਹੜਾ ਸੁਤਾ ਕੁਫਰ ਕੁਫਾਰੀ
transliteration: Jeevani Maaree Lati Dee Kayharhaa Soutaa Kudhar Kudhaaree.
translation: The qazi named Jivan kicked him and asked who was this infidel enacting  blasphemy.

gurmukhi: ਲਤਾ ਵਲਿ ਖੁਦਾੲਿਦੇ ਕਿੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਪੲਿਅਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਬਜਿਗਾਰੀ
transliteration: Lataa Vali Khudaai Day Kiu Kari Paiaa Hoi Bajigaaree.
translation: Why this sinner is sleeping his legs spread towards God, Khuda.

gurmukhi: ਟੰਗੋਂ ਪਕੜਿ ਘਸੀਟਿਅਾ ਫਿਰਿਅਾ ਮਕਾ ਕਲਾ ਦਿਖਾਰੀ
transliteration: Tangon Pakarhi Ghaseetiaa Dhiriaa Makaa Kalaa Dikhaaree.
translation: Catching hold of the legs he lynched (Baba Nanak) and lo and behold the miracle, the whole of Mecca seemed to be revolving.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਹੈਰਾਨੁ ਕਰੇਨਿ ਜੁਹਾਰੀ ॥੩੨॥
transliteration: Hoi Hairaanu Karayni Juhaaree ?32?
translation: All got surprised and they all bowed.

gurmukhi: ੩੩ ਕਾਜ਼ੀਅਾਂ ਮੁੱਲਾਂ ਨਾਲ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ਨੋਤਰ
translation: Discussion with the Qazis

gurmukhi: ਪੁਛਨਿ ਗਲ ੲੀਮਾਨ ਦੀ ਕਾਜੀ ਮੁਲਾਂ ੲਿਕਠੇ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Pouchhani Gal Eemaan Dee Kaajee Mulaan Ikatday Hoee.
translation: Qazi and maulvis got together and began discussing religion.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਾ ਸਾਂਗ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ ਲਖਿ ਨ ਸਕੈ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Vadaa Saang Varataaiaa Lakhi N Sakai Kudarati Koee.
translation: A great fantasy has been created and no one could understood its mystery.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਛਨਿ ਫੋਲਿ ਕਿਤਾਬ ਨੋ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਵਡਾ ਕਿ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨੋੲੀ
transliteration: Pouchhani Dholi Kitaab No Hindoo Vadaa Ki Mousalamaanoee.
translation: They asked Baba Nanak to open and search in his book whether Hindu is great or the Muslim.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਅਾਖੇ ਹਾਜੀਅਾ ਸੁਭਿ ਅਮਲਾ ਬਾਝਹੁ ਦੋਨੋ ਰੋੲੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Aakhay Haajeeaa Soubhi Amalaa Baajhahu Dono Roee.
translation: Baba replied to the pilgrim hajis, that, without good deeds both will have to weep and  wail.

gurmukhi: ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨ ਦੁੲਿ ਦਰਗਹ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਲਹਨਿ ਨ ਢੋੲੀ
transliteration: Hindoo Mousalamaan Dui Daragah Andari Lahani N Ddhoee.
translation: Only by being a Hindu or a Muslim one  can not get accepted in the court of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਕਚਾ ਰੰਗੁ ਕਸੁੰਭ ਦਾ ਪਾਣੀ ਧੋਤੈ ਥਿਰ ਨ ਰਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Kachaa Rangu Kousanbh Daa Paanee Dhotai Diru N Rahoee.
translation: As the colour of safflower is impermanent and is washed away in water, likewise the colours of religiosity are also temporary.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਨਿ ਬਖੀਲੀ ਅਾਪਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਾਮ ਰਹੀਮ ੲਿਕ ਥਾੲਿ ਖਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Karani Bakheelee Aapi Vichi Raam Raheem Kudaai Khaloee.
translation: (Followers of both the religions) In their  expositions, denounce Ram and Rahim.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਹਿ ਸੈਤਾਨੀ ਦੁਨੀਅਾਂ ਗੋੲੀ ॥੩੩॥
transliteration: Raahi Saitaanee Douneeaa Goee ?33?
translation: The whole of the world is following the ways of Satan.

gurmukhi: ੩੪ ਮੱਕੇ ਦੀ ਦਿਗ ਬਿਜਯ
translation: Victory at Mecca

gurmukhi: ਧਰੀ ਨੀਸਾਣੀ ਕੳੁਸ ਦੀ ਮਕੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪੂਜ ਕਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dharee Neesaanee Kaousi Dee Makay Andari Pooj Karaaee.
translation: Wooden sandal (of Baba Nanak ) was kept as a memory and he was woshipped in Mecca.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਥੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਜਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਬਾਬੇ ਬਾਝੁ ਨ ਖਾਲੀ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jidai Jaai Jagati Vichi Baabay Baajhu N Khaalee Jaaee.
translation: Go anywhere in the world, you would not find a place bereft of the name of Baba Nanak.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਬਾਬਾ ਪੂਜੀਅੈ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨ ਗੁਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ghari Ghari Baabaa Poojeeai Hindoo Mousalamaan Guaaee.
translation: Without discrimination of Hindu or Muslim, in every house, the Baba is revered.

gurmukhi: ਛਪੇ ਨਾਹਿ ਛਪਾੲਿਅਾ ਚੜਿਅਾ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਜਗੁ ਰੁਸਨਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chhapay Naahi Chhapaaiaa Charhiaa Sooraju Jagu Rousanaaee.
translation: When the sun rises it cannot be covered and it lightens the whole world.

gurmukhi: ਬੁਕਿਅਾ ਸਿੰਘ ੳੁਜਾੜ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਭਿ ਮਿਰਗਾਵਲਿ ਭੰਨੀ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Boukiaa Singh Ujaarh Vichi Sabhi Miragaavali Bhannee Jaaee.
translation: When the lion roared in the jungle the flocks of deer ran away.

gurmukhi: ਚੜਿਅਾ ਚੰਦੁ ਨ ਲੁਕੲੀ ਕਢਿ ਕੁਨਾਲੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਛਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Charhiaa Chandu N Loukaee Kaddhi Kounaalee Joti Chhapaaee.
translation: If someone wants to conceal moon by putting before it a platter, it cannot be hide.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਗਵਣਿ ਤੇ ਅਾਥਵਣੋ ਨੳੁਖੰਡ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮੀ ਸਭਾ ਝੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ougavanahu Tay Aadavano Nau Khand Pridamee Sabh Jhoukaaee.
translation: From rising to setting  directions i.e from east to west, all the nine divisions of earth bowed before Baba Nanak.

gurmukhi: ਜਗ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਵਰਤਾੲੀ ॥੩੪॥
transliteration: Jagi Andari Kudarati Varataaee ?34?
translation: He diffused his power in whole of the world.

gurmukhi: ੩੫ ਬਗ਼ਦਾਦ ਗਮਨ
translation: Going to Baghdad

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਬਾਬਾ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਬਗ਼ਦਾਦ ਨੋ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੀਅਾ ਅਸਥਾਨਾ
transliteration: Dhiri Baabaa Gaiaa Bagadaadi No Baahari Jaai Keeaa Asadaanaa.
translation: From Mecca Baba went to Baghdad and stayed outside the city.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਬਾਬਾ ਅਕਾਲ ਰੂਪੁ ਦੂਜਾ ਰਬਾਬੀ ਮਰਦਾਨਾ
transliteration: Iku Baabaa Akaal Roupoo Doojaa Rabaabee Maradaanaa.
translation: Firstly, Baba himself was in the form of Timeless and secondly, he had his companion Mardana, the rebeck player.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਤੀ ਬਾਂਗਿ ਨਿਵਾਜਿ ਕਰਿ ਸੁੰਨਿ ਸਮਾਨਿ ਹੋਅਾ ਜਹਾਨਾ
transliteration: Ditee Baangi Nivaaji Kari Sounni Samaani Hoaa Jahaanaa.
translation: For namaz (in his own style), Baba gave call, listening to which the whole world went into absolute silence.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਨ ਮੁੰਨਿ ਨਗਰੀ ਭੲੀ ਦੇਖਿ ਪੀਰ ਭੲਿਅਾ ਹੈਰਾਨਾ
transliteration: Sounn Mounni Nagaree Bhaee Daykhi Peer Bhaiaa Hairaanaa.
translation: The whole city became quiet and lo! to behold it, the pir (of the town) also got wonderstruck.

gurmukhi: ਵੇਖੈ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਲਗਾੲਿ ਕਰਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਫਕੀਰੁ ਵਡਾ ਮਸਤਾਨਾ
transliteration: Vaykhai Dhiaanu Lagaai Kari Iku Dhakeeru Vadaa Masataanaa.
translation: Observing minutely he found (in the form of Baba Nanak) an exhilerated faquir.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਛਿਅਾ ਫਿਰਿ ਕੈ ਦਸਤਗੀਰ ਕੳੁਣ ਫਕੀਰ ਕਿਸ ਕਾ ਘਰਿਹਾਨਾ
transliteration: Pouchhiaa Dhiri Kai Dasatageer Kaoun Dhakeeru Kisakaa Ghariaanaa
translation: Pir Dastegir asked him, which category of faquir you belong to and what is your parentage.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਨਕ ਕਲਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਰਬੁ ਫਕੀਰੁ ੲਿਕੋ ਪਹਿਚਾਨਾ
transliteration: Naanak Kali Vichi Aaiaa Rabu Dhakeeru Iko Pahichaanaa.
translation: (Mardana told) He is Nanak, who has come into kaliyug, and, he recognises God and His faquirs as one.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤਿ ਅਾਕਾਸ ਚਹੂ ਦਿਸ ਜਾਨਾ ॥੩੫॥
transliteration: Dharati Aakaas Chahoo Disi Jaanaa ?35?
translation: He is known in all the directions besides earth and sky.

gurmukhi: ੩੬ ਜ਼ਾਹਰੀ ਕਲਾ
translation: Manifest power

gurmukhi: ਪੁਛੇ ਪੀਰ ਤਕਰਾਰ ਕਰਿ ੲੇਹ ਫਕੀਰ ਵਡਾ ਅਤਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pouchhay Peer Takaraar Kari Ayhu Dhakeeru Vadaa Ataaee.
translation: The pir debated and came to know that this faquir is much more powerful.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਥੇ ਵਿਚਿ ਬਗਦਾਦ ਦੇ ਵਡੀ ਕਰਾਮਾਤਿ ਦਿਖਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ayday Vichi Bagadaad Day Vadee Karaamaati Dikhalaaee.
translation: Here in Baghdad he has shown a great miracle.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਤਾਲਾ ਅਾਕਾਸ ਲਖ ਓੜਕਿ ਭਾਲੀ ਖਬਰੁ ਸੁਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Paataalaa Aakaas Lakhi Aorhaki Bhaalee Khabari Sounaaee.
translation: Meanwhile he (Baba Nanak) talked about myriads of netherworlds and skies.

gurmukhi: ਫੇਰਿ ਦੁਰਾੲਿਣ ਦਸਤਗੀਰ ਅਸੀ ਭਿ ਵੇਖਾ ਜੋ ਤੁਹਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dhayri Duraain Dasatageer Asee Bhi Vaykhaa Jo Tuhi Paaee.
translation: Pir Dastegir asked (the Baba) to show him whatever he had seen.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਲਿ ਲੀਤਾ ਬੇਟਾ ਪੀਰ ਦਾ ਅਖੀ ਮੀਟਿ ਗੲਿਅਾ ਹਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Naali Leetaa Baytaa Peer Daa Akhee Meeti Gaiaa Havaaee.
translation: Guru Nanak Dev  taking along with him the son of the pir, melted into thin air.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਅਾਕਾਸ ਪਤਾਲ ਲਖ ਅਖਿ ਫੁਰੰਕ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਭਿ ਦਿਖਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lakh Aakaas Pataal Lakh Akhi Phurak Vichi Sabhi Dikhalaaee.
translation: And in a wink of eye visualized him the upper and lower worlds.

gurmukhi: ਭਰਿ ਕਚਕੌਲ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ਦਾ ਧੁਰੋ ਪਤਾਲੋ ਲੲੀ ਕੜਾਹੀ
transliteration: Bhari Kachakaul Prasaadi Daa Dhuro Pataalo Laee Karhaahee.
translation: From the nether world he brought a bowl full of sacred food and handed it over to pir.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਹਰ ਕਲਾ ਨ ਛਪੈ ਛਪਾੲੀ ॥੩੬॥
transliteration: Jaahar Kalaa N Chhapai Chhapaaee ?36?
translation: This manifest power (of the Guru) cannot be made to hide.

gurmukhi: ੩੭ ਸੱਤਿਨਾਮ ਚੱਕਰ
translation: Cycle of the true Name

gurmukhi: ਗੜ ਬਗਦਾਦੁ ਨਿਵਾੲਿਕੈ ਮਕਾ ਮਦੀਨਾ ਸਭੇ ਨਿਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Garh Bagadaadu Nivaai Kai Makaa Madeenaa Sabhay Nivaaiaa.
translation: After making Baghdad, the citadels( of pirs)bow, Mecca Medina and all were humbled.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀਹ ਮੰਡਲੀ ਖਟਿ ਦਰਸਨਿ ਪਾਖੰਡਿ ਜਿਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sidh Chauraaseeh Mandalee Khati Darasani Paakhandi Jinaaiaa.
translation: He ( Baba Nanak) subjugated the eighty four siddhs and hypocrises of the six schools of Indian Philosophy

gurmukhi: ਪਾਤਾਲਾ ਅਾਕਾਸ ਲਖ ਜੀਤੀ ਧਰਤੀ ਜਗਤੁ ਸਬਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paataalaa Aakaas Lakh Jeetee Dharatee Jagat Sabaaiaa.
translation: Lacs of underworlds, the skies, earths and the whole world were conquered.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਤੀ ਨੳੁਖੰਡ ਮੇਦਨੀ ਸਤਿਨਾਮ ਦਾ ਚਕ੍ਰ ਫਿਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jeetay Nav Khand Maydanee Sati Naamu Daa Chakr Dhiraaiaa.
translation: Subjugating all the nine divisions of earth he established the cycle of Satinaam, the true name

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵਦਾਨੋ ਰਾਕਸਿ ਦੈਤ ਸਭ ਚਿਤਿਗੁਪਤਿ ਸਭਿ ਚਰਨੀ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dayv Daano Raakasi Dait Sabh Chiti Goupati Sabhi Charanee Laaiaa.
translation: All the Gods, demons, raksasas, daity's, Chitragupt bowed at his feet.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰਾਸਣਿ ਅਪਛਰਾ ਰਾਗ ਰਾਗਨੀ ਮੰਗਲੁ ਗਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Indraasani Apachharaa Raag Raaganee Mangalu Gaaiaa.
translation: Indra and his nymphs sang auspicious songs.

gurmukhi: ਭੲਿਅਾ ਅਨੰਦ ਜਗਤੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਲਿ ਤਾਰਨ ਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhaiaa Anad Jagatu Vichi Kali Taaran Guru Naanaku Aaiaa.
translation: The world filled with joy because Guru Nanak came to give deliverance to the kaliyug.

gurmukhi: ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣਿ ਨਿਵਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੩੭॥
transliteration: Hindoo Mousalamaani Nivaaiaa ?37?
translation: He made Hindu Muslim humble and suppliant

gurmukhi: ੩੮ ਕਰਤਾਰ ਪੁਰ ਅਾਗਮਾਨ
translation: Reaching Kartarpur

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਬਾਬਾ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਕਰਤਾਰਪੁਰਿ ਭੇਖੁ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ ਸਗਲ ੳੁਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Dhiri Baabaa Aaiaa Karataarapur Bhaykhu Udaasee Sagal Outaaraa.
translation: Then Baba (Nanak) returned to Kartarpur where he put aside his attire of a Recluse.

gurmukhi: ਪਹਿਰਿ ਸੰਸਾਰੀ ਕਪੜੇ ਮੰਜੀ ਬੈਠਿ ਕੀਅਾ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Pahiri Sansaaree Kaparhay Manjee Baitdi Keeaa Avataaraa.
translation: Now putting on a householder’s dress, he sat splendidly on a cot (and executed his mission).

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲਟੀ ਗੰਗ ਵਹਾੲੀਓਨਿ ਗੁਰ ਅੰਗਦੁ ਸਿਰਿ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਧਾਰਾ
transliteration: Ulatee Gang Vahaaeeaoni Gur Angadu Siri Oupari Dhaaraa.
translation: He made the Ganges flow in opposite  direction because he choose Angad for heading the people (in preference to his sons).

gurmukhi: ਪੁਤਰੀ ਕੳੁਲੁ ਨ ਪਾਲਿਅਾ ਮਨਿ ਖੋਟੇ ਅਾਕੀ ਨਸਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Poutaree Kaulu N Paaliaa Mani Khotay Aakee Nasiaaraa.
translation: The sons did not obey the commands and their minds turned hostile and unstable.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਣੀ ਮੁਖਹੁ ੳੁਚਾਰੀਅੈ ਹੁੲਿ ਰੁਸਨਾੲੀ ਮਿਟੈ ਅੰਧਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Baanee Moukhahu Ouchaareeai Hui Rousanaaee Mitai Andhaaraa.
translation: When Baba uttered hymns, the light would spread and darkness dispell.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਗੋਸਟਿ ਚਰਚਾ ਸਦਾ ਅਨਹਦਿ ਸਬਦਿ ੳੁਠੇ ਧੁਨਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Giaanu Gosati Charachaa Sadaa Anahadi Sabadi Outday Dhounakaaraa.
translation: Discussions for the sake of knowledge and the melodies of unstruck sound were ever heard there.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਦਰੁ ਅਾਰਤੀ ਗਾਵੀਅੈ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵੇਲੇ ਜਾਪੁ ੳੁਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sodaru Aaratee Gaaveeai Anmrit Vaylay Jaapu Ouchaaraa.
translation: Sodar and Arati were sung and in the ambrosial hours Japu was recited.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਭਾਰ ਅਥਰਬਣਿ ਤਾਰਾ ॥੩੮॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Bhaari Adarabaani Taaraa ?38?
translation: The Gurmukh (Nanak) saved the people from the clutches of tantra, mantra and Atharvaveda.

gurmukhi: ੩੯ ਸ਼ਿਵਰਾਤ੍ਰੀ
translation: Sivratri fair at Batala

gurmukhi: ਮੇਲਾ ਸੁਣਿ ਸਿਵਰਾਤਿ ਦਾ ਬਾਬਾ ਅਚਲ ਵਟਾਲੇ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maylaa Souni Sivaraati Daa Baabaa Achal Vataalay Aaee.
translation: Hearing about the Sivratri fair, Baba (Nanak) came to Achal Batala.

gurmukhi: ਦਰਸਨੁ ਵੇਖਣਿ ਕਾਰਨੇ ਸਗਲੀ ੳੁਲਟਿ ਪੲੀ ਲੋਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Darasanu Vaykhani Kaaranay Sagalee Ulati Paee Lokaaee.
translation: To have his glimpse the whole humanity swarmed the place.

gurmukhi: ਲਗੀ ਬਰਸਣਿ ਲਛਮੀ ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨੳੁ ਨਿਧਿ ਸਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lagee Barasani Lachhamee Ridhi Sidhi Nau Nidhi Savaaee.
translation: More than riddhis and siddhis, the money started pouring in like rain.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗੀ ਦੇਖਿ ਚਲਿਤ੍ਰ ਨੋ ਮਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਿਸਕਿ ਘਨੇਰੀ ਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jogee Daykhi Chalitr No Man Vichi Risaki Ghanayree Khaaee.
translation: Seeing this miracle, the yogis’ anger was aroused.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੀਅਾ ਪਾੲੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਅਾਣਿ ਲੋਟਾ ਜੋਗੀ ਲੲਿਅਾ ਛਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhagateeaa Paaee Bhagati Aani Lotaa Jogee Laiaa Chhapaaee.
translation: When some of the devotees paid obeisance (before Guru Nanak), the yogis’ ire deepened and they hid their metal pot.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੀਅਾ ਗੲੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੁਲਿ ਲੋਟੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਭੁਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhagateeaa Gaee Bhagati Bhuli Lotay Andari Surati Bhulaaee.
translation: The devotees having lost their pot forgot their devotion because their attention now was in the pot.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਜਾਣੀ ਜਾਣ ਪੁਰਖ ਕਢਿਅਾ ਲੋਟਾ ਜਹਾ ਲੁਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Jaanee Jaan Purakh Kaddhiaa Lotaa Jahaa Loukaaee.
translation: The omniscient Baba discovered (and handed over) the pot (to devotees).

gurmukhi: ਵੇਖਿ ਚਲਿਤ੍ਰਿ ਜੋਗੀ ਖੁਣਿਸਾੲੀ ॥੩੯॥
transliteration: Vaykhi Chalitri Jogee Khounisaaee ?39?
translation: Witnessing this the yogis were further enraged

gurmukhi: ੪੦ ਸਿੱਧਾਂ ਨਾਲ ਗੋਸ਼ਟ
translation: Discussion with the siddhs

gurmukhi: ਖਾਧੀ ਖੁਣਸਿ ਜੁਗੀਸਰਾਂ ਗੋਸਟਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਸਭੇ ੳੁਠਿ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Khaadhee Khounasi Jogeesaraan Gosati Karani Sabhay Outdi Aaee.
translation: All the yogis getting irritated grouped together and came forward to have a debate.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਛੇ ਜੋਗੀ ਭੰਗਰ ਨਾਥੁ ਤੁਹਿ ਦੁਧ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਿੳੁਂ ਕਾਂਜੀ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pouchhay Jogee Bhangar Naadu Tuhi Dudh Vichi Kiu Kaanjee Paaee.
translation: Yogi Bhangar Nath asked, (Why have you put vinegar in milk?)

gurmukhi: ਫਿਟਿਅਾ ਚਾਟਾ ਦੁਧ ਦਾ ਰਿੜਕਿਅਾ ਮਖਣੁ ਹਥਿ ਨ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dhitiaa Chaataa Dudh Daa Rirhakiaa Makhanu Hadi N Aaee.
translation: The spoiled milk cannot be churned into butter.

gurmukhi: ਭੇਖੁ ੳੁਤਾਰਿ ੳੁਦਾਸਿ ਦਾ ਵਤਿ ਕਿੳੁ ਸੰਸਾਰੀ ਰੀਤਿ ਚਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaykh Outaari Udaasi Daa Vati Kiu Sansaaree Reeti Chalaaee
translation: How have you put off yogic garb and attired yourself in a household way.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਨਕ ਅਾਖੇ ਭੰਗਰ ਨਾਥ ਤੇਰੀ ਮਾੳੁ ਕੁਚਜੀ ਅਾਹੀ
transliteration: Naanak Aakhay Bhangarinaad Tayree Maau Kouchajee Aahee.
translation: Said Nanak, (O Bhangar Nath, your mother-teacher is unmannerly)

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਡਾ ਧੋੲਿ ਨ ਜਾਤਿਓਨਿ ਭਾੲਿ ਕੁਚਜੇ ਫੁਲੁ ਸੜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaandaa Dhoi N Jaatiaoni Bhaai Kouchajay Phulu Sarhaaee.
translation: She has not cleansed the innerself of your body-pot and your clumpsy thoughts have burnt your flower (of knowledge which was to become fruit).

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਅਤੀਤੁ ਗ੍ਹਿਸਤਿ ਤਜਿ ਫਿਰਿ ੳੁਨਹੁ ਕੇ ਘਰਿ ਮੰਗਣਿ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Hoi Ateetu Grihasati Taji Dhiri Ounahu Kay Ghari Mangani Jaaee.
translation: You, while distancing and repudiating house hold life, go again to those householders for begging.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੁ ਦਿਤੇ ਕਛੁ ਹਥਿ ਨ ਅਾੲੀ ॥੪੦॥
transliteration: Binu Ditay Kachhu Hadi N Aaee ?40?
translation: Except their offerings you don’t get anything.

gurmukhi: ੪੧ ਸਿੱਧ ਕਰਾਮਾਤ
translation: Miracles by the siddhs

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਬਚਨ ਜੋਗੀਸਰਾਂ ਮਾਰਿ ਕਿਲਕ ਬਹੁ ਰੂੲਿ ੳੁਠਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ihi Souni Bachani Jogeesaraan Maari Kilak Bahu Rooi Outdaaee.
translation: Listening to this, the yogis snarled loudly and invoked many spirits.

gurmukhi: ਖਟਿ ਦਰਸਨ ਕੳੁ ਖੇਦਿਅਾ ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਨਾਨਕ ਬੇਦੀ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Khati Darasan Kau Khaydiaa Kalijougi Naanak Baydee Aaee.
translation: They said, (In kaliyug, Bedi Nanak has trampled and driven away the six schools of Indian philosophy).

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧਿ ਬੋਲਨਿ ਸਭਿ ਅਵਖਧੀਅਾ ਤੰਤ੍ਰ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਕੀ ਧੁਨੋ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sidhi Bolani Sabhi Avakhadheeaa Tantr Mantr Kee Dhouno Charhhaaee.
translation: Saying thus, the Siddhs counted all sorts of medicines and started making tantric sounds of the mantras.

gurmukhi: ਰੂਪ ਵਟਾੲੇ ਜੋਗੀਅਾ ਸਿੰਘ ਬਾਘਿ ਬਹੁ ਚਲਿਤਿ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Roop Vataaay Jogeeaan Singh Baaghi Bahu Chaliti Dikhaaee.
translation: Yogis changed themselves into the forms of lions and tigers and performed many actions.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਿ ਪਰਿ ਕਰਿਕੈ ੳੁਡਰਨਿ ਪੰਖੀ ਜਿਵੈ ਰਹੈ ਲੀਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Iki Pari Kari Kai Udarani Pankhee Jivai Rahay Leelaaee.
translation: Some of them became winged and flew like birds.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਨਾ ਨਾਗਹੋੲਿ ਪੳੁਣ ਛੋੜਿਅਾ ੲਿਕਨਾ ਵਰਖਾ ਅਗਨਿ ਵਸਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ik Naag Hoi Paoun Chhorhiaa Ikanaa Varakhaa Agani Vasaaee.
translation: Some started hissing like cobra and some poured out fire.

gurmukhi: ਤਾਰੇ ਤੋੜੇ ਭੰਗਰਿਨਾਥ ੲਿਕ ਚੜਿ ਮਿਰਗਾਨੀ ਜਲੁ ਤਰਿ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Taaray Torhay Bhangarinaad Ik Charhi Miragaanee Jalu Tari Jaaee.
translation: Bhangar nath plucked the stars and many upon deer skin started floating on water.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧਾ ਅਗਨਿ ਨ ਬੁਝੈ ਬੁਝਾੲੀ ॥੪੧॥
transliteration: Sidhaa Agani N Bujhai Bujhaaee ?41?
translation: The fire (of desires) of the siddhs was unextinguishable.

gurmukhi: ੪੨ ਸਿੱਧ ਪ੍ਰਸ਼ੋਤਰ
translation: Question of siddhs

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧਿ ਬੋਲਨਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਨਾਨਕਾ ਤੁਹਿ ਜਗ ਨੋ ਕਿਅਾ ਕਰਾਮਾਤਿ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sidhi Bolani Souni Naanakaa Tuhi Jag No Karaamaati Dikhaaee.
translation: Siddhs spoke, Listen O Nanak! You have shown miracles to the world.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਝ ਵਿਖਾਲੇਂ ਅਸਾ ਨੋ ਤੁਹਿ ਕਿੳੁ ਢਿਲ ਅਵੇਹੀ ਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kujhu Vikhaalayn Asaan No Tuhi Kioun Ddhil Avayhee Laaee.
translation: Why are you late in showing some to us.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਬੋਲੇ ਨਾਥ ਜੀ ਅਸਾਂ ਤੇ ਵੇਖਣਿ ਜੋਗੀ ਵਸਤੁ ਨ ਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Bolay Naad Jee Asi Vaykhani Jogee Vasatu N Kaaee.
translation: Baba replied, O respected Nath! I have nothing worth showing to you.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਬਾਣੀ ਬਿਨਾ ਦੂਜੀ ਓਟ ਨਹੀਂ ਹਹਿ ਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Guru Sangati Baanee Binaa Doojee Aot Nahee Hai Raaee.
translation: I have no support except of the Guru (God), holy congregation, and the Word (bani).

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਰੂਪੀ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਚਲੇ ਨਾਹੀ ਧਰਤਿ ਚਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Siv Roopee Karataa Purakhu Chalay Naahee Dharati Chalaaee.
translation: That Paramatman who is all full of benedictions (sivam) for all is stable and the earth (and material over it) is transitory.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਤੰਤ੍ਰ ਮੰਤ੍ਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਝੜਿ ਪੲੇ ਸਬਦਿ ਗੁਰੂ ਕੇ ਕਲਾ ਛਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sidhi Tantr Mantri Kari Jharhi Paay Sabadi Guroo Kay Kalaa Chhapaaee.
translation: The siddhs exhausted themselves with the tantra-mantras but the world of Lord did not allow their powers to come up.

gurmukhi: ਦਦੇ ਦਾਤਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਹੈ ਕਕੇ ਕੀਮਤ ਕਿਨੈ ਨ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Daday Daataa Guroo Hai Kakay Keemati Kinai N Paaee.
translation: The Guru is the giver and no one can gauge his bounties.

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਦੀਨ ਨਾਨਕ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ ॥੪੨॥
transliteration: So Deen Naanak Satiguru Saranaaee ?42?
translation: Utimately, the humbled yogis submitted before the true Guru Nanak.

gurmukhi: ੪੩ ਸੱਤਿਨਾਮ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਤਾਪ
translation: Grandeur of the true name

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬਾ ਬੋਲੇ ਨਾਥ ਜੀ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਨਹੁ ਸਚੁ ਮੁਖਹੁ ਅਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabaa Bolay Naad Jee Sabadu Sounahu Sachu Moukhahu Alaaee.
translation: Baba (further) said, O respected Nath! Please listen to the truth that I utter.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਝੋ ਸਚੇ ਨਾਮ ਦੇ ਹੋਰੁ ਕਰਾਮਾਤਿ ਅਸਾਂ ਤੇ ਨਾਹੀ
transliteration: Baajho Sachay Naam Day Horu Karaamaati Asaan Tay Naahee.
translation: Without the true Name no else miracle I have.

gurmukhi: ਬਸਤਰਿ ਪਹਿਰੌ ਅਗਨਿ ਕੈ ਬਰਫ ਹਿਮਾਲੇ ਮੰਦਰੁ ਛਾੲੀ
transliteration: Basatari Pahirau Agani Kai Baradh Himaalay Mandaru Chhaaee.
translation: I may wear the clothes of fire and build my house in the Himalayas.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੌ ਰਸੋੲੀ ਸਾਰ ਦੀ ਸਗਲੀ ਧਰਤੀ ਨਥਿ ਚਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Karau Rasoee Saari Dee Sagalee Dharatee Nadi Chalaaee.
translation: I may eat the iron and make earth move to my orders.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਵਡੁ ਕਰੀ ਵਿਥਾਰ ਕੳੁ ਸਗਲੀ ਧਰਤੀ ਨਥਿ ਚਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ayvadu Karee Vidaari Kau Sagalee Dharatee Hakee Jaaee.
translation: I may expand myself so much that I could push the earth.

gurmukhi: ਤੋਲੀ ਧਰਤਿ ਅਕਾਸਿ ਦੁੲਿ ਪਿਛੇ ਛਾਬੇ ਟੰਕੁ ਚੜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Tolee Dharati Akaasi Dui Pichhay Chhaabay Tanku Charhaaee.
translation: I may weigh the earth and the sky against few grams of weight.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਲੁ ਰਖਾ ਅਾਪਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਿਸੁ ਅਾਖਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਪਾਸਿ ਕਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ihi Balu Rakhaa Aapi Vichi Jisu Aakhaa Tisu Paasi Karaaee.
