translation: I may have so much of power that I push aside anybody by saying.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਨਾਮ ਬਿਨੁ ਬਾਦਰਿ ਛਾੲੀ ॥੪੩॥
transliteration: Sati Naamu Binu Baadari Chhaaee ?43?
translation: But without the true Name, these all (powers) are momentary like the Shadow of the clouds.

gurmukhi: ੪੪ ਸਿੱਧ ਗੋਸ਼ਟ ਮੁਲਤਾਨ
translation: Discussion with the siddhs and tour of Multan

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬੇ ਕੀਤੀ ਸਿਧਿ ਗੋਸਟਿ ਸਬਦਿ ਸਾਂਤਿ ਸਿਧਾਂ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabay Keetee Sidhi Gosati Sabadi Saanti Sidhaan Vichi Aaee.
translation: Baba has discussions with the siddhs and because of th eenergy of the sabad those siddhs attained peace.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਣਿ ਮੇਲਾ ਸਿਵਰਾਤਿ ਦਾ ਖਟ ਦਰਸਨ ਅਾਦੇਸਿ ਕਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jini Maylaa Sivaraati Daa Khat Darasani Aadaysi Karaaee.
translation: Conquering the Sivratri fair Baba made the followers of six philosophies bow.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧਿ ਬੋਲਨਿ ਸੁਭ ਬਚਨਿ ਧਨੁ ਨਾਨਕ ਤੇਰੀ ਵਡੀ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sidhi Bolani Soubhi Bachani Dhanu Naanak Tayree Vadee Kamaaee.
translation: Now, speaking benign words, the siddhs said, Nanak, your achievement is great.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਪਰਗਟਿਅਾ ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਜਗਾੲੀ
transliteration: Vadaa Purakhu Paragatiaa Kalijougi Andari Joti Jagaaee.
translation: You, emerging like a  greatman in kaliyug have diffused the light (of knowledge) all around.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਲਿਓ ਬਾਬਾ ੳੁਠਿਅਾ ਮੁਲਤਾਨੇ ਦੀ ਜਾਰਤਿ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Mayliao Baabaa Outdiaa Mulataanay Dee Jaarati Jaaee.
translation: Getting up from that fair, Baba went to the pilgrimage of Multan.

gurmukhi: ਅਗੋਂ ਪੀਰ ਮੁਲਤਾਨ ਦੇ ਦੁਧਿ ਕਟੋਰਾ ਭਰਿ ਲੈ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Agon Peer Mulataan Day Dudhi Katoraa Bhari Lai Aaee.
translation: In Multan, the pir presented a bowl of milk filled up to brims (which means That faquirs here are already in plenty).

gurmukhi: ਬਾਬੇ ਕਢਿ ਕਰਿ ਬਗਲ ਤੇ ਚੰਬੇਲੀ ਦੁਧ ਵਿਚਿ ਮਿਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Baabay Kaddhi Kari Bagal Tay Chanbaylee Dudhi Vichi Milaaee.
translation: Baba took out a jasmine flower from his bag and floated it on the milk (which meant that he wa not going to put anybody to trouble).

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਸਾਗਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੰਗ ਸਮਾੲੀ ॥੪੪॥
transliteration: Jiu Saagari Vichi Gang Samaaee ?44?
translation: It was such a scene as if the Ganges were merging into the sea.

gurmukhi: ੪੫ ਗੁਰੂ ਅੰਗਦ
translation: Guru Angad

gurmukhi: ਜਾਰਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਮੁਲਤਾਨ ਦੀ ਫਿਰਿ ਕਰਤਾਰ ਪੁਰੇ ਨੋ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jaarati Kari Mulataan Dee Dhiri Karataari Puray No Aaiaa.
translation: After the journey of Multan, Baba Nanak again turned towards Kartarpur.

gurmukhi: ਚੜ੍ਹੇ ਸਵਾੲੀ ਦਿਹਿ ਦਿਹੀ ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮੁ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charhhay Savaaee Dihi Dihee Kalijougi Naanak Naamu Dhiaaiaa.
translation: His impact increased by leaps and bounds and he made people of kaliyug remember Nam.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਹੋਰੁ ਮੰਗਣਾ ਸਿਰਿ ਦੁਖਾ ਦੇ ਦੁਖ ਸਬਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Vinu Naavai Horu Manganaa Siri Doukhaan Day Doukh Sabaaiaa.
translation: Desiring anything except the Nam of the Lord, is  invitation to multiplying sufferings.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਰਿਅਾ ਸਿਕਾ ਜਗਤ੍ਰਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਾਨਕ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਪੰਥ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Maariaa Sikaa Jagati Vichi Naanak Niramal Pandu Chalaaiaa.
translation: In the world, he established the authority (of his doctrines) and started a religion, devoid of any impurity (niramal panth).

gurmukhi: ਥਾਪਿਅਾ ਲਹਿਣਾ ਜੀਵਦੇ ਗੁਰਿਅਾੲੀ ਸਿਰਿ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਫਿਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Daapiaa Lahinaa Jeenvaday Guriaaee Siri Chhatr Dhiraaiaa.
translation: During his life time he waved the canopy of Guru seat on the head of Lahina(Guru Angad) and merged his own light into him.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਕੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਰੂਪ ਵਟਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jotee Joti Milaai Kai Satigur Naanaki Roopu Vataaiaa.
translation: Guru Nanak now transformed himself.

gurmukhi: ਲਖਿ ਨ ਕੋੲੀ ਸਕੲੀ ਅਾਚਰਜੇ ਅਾਚਰਜ ਦਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lakhi N Koee Sakaee Aacharajay Aacharaju Dikhaaiaa.
translation: This mystery is incomprehensible for anybody that awe-inspiring (Nanak) accomplished a wonderful task.

gurmukhi: ਕਾੲਿਅਾ ਪਲਟਿ ਸਰੂਪ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੪੫॥
transliteration: Kaaiaa Palati Saroopu Banaaiaa ?45?
translation: He converted (his body) into a new form.

gurmukhi: ੪੬ ਗੁਰ ਅਮਰਦਾਸ ਜੀ
translation: Guru Amar Das

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਟਿਕਾ ਸੋ ਛਤ੍ਰੁ ਸਿਰਿ ਸੋੲੀ ਸਚਾ ਤਖਤੁ ਟਿਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: So Tikaa So Chhatr Siri Soee Sachaa Takhatu Tikaaee.
translation: With the same mark (on the forehead), the same canopy he radiated on the Throne.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਹੰਦੀ ਮੁਹਰ ਹਥਿ ਗੁਰ ਅੰਗਦ ਦੀ ਦੋਹੀ ਫਿਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Gur Naanak Handee Muhari Hadi Gur Angad Dee Dohee Dhiraaee.
translation: The power Guru Nanak had is now with Guru Angad was publically proclaimed all around.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਤਾ ਛੋੜਿ ਕਰਤਾਰ ਪੁਰੁ ਬੈਠਿ ਖਡੂਰੇ ਜੋਤਿ ਜਗਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ditaa Chhorhi Karataar Puru Baitdi Khadooray Joti Jagaaee.
translation: Guru Angad left Kartarpur and scattered his light while sitting at Khadur.

gurmukhi: ਜੰਮੇ ਪੂਰਬਿ ਬੀਜਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਹੋਰੁ ਕੂੜੀ ਚਤੁਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Janmay Poorabi Beejiaa Vichi Vichi Horu Koorhee Chaturaaee.
translation: Action seeds of the previous births sprout; all other ingenuinities are false.

gurmukhi: ਲਹਣੇ ਪਾੲੀ ਨਾਨਕੋ ਦੇਣੀ ਅਮਰਦਾਸਿ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lahanay Paaee Naanako Daynee Amaradaasi Ghari Aaee.
translation: Whatever Lahina got from Guru Nanak now came to the house of (Guru) Amar Das.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਬੈਠਾ ਅਮਰੁ ਸਰੂਪ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪਾੲੀ ਦਾਤਿ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ
transliteration: Guru Baitdaa Amaru Saroop Hoi Guramoukhi Paaee Daadi Ilaahee.
translation: Having received the celestial gift from Guru Angad, the Guru, in the form of Amar Das is seated.

gurmukhi: ਫੇਰਿ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ ਗੋੲਿੰਦਵਾਲੁ ਅਚਰਜੁ ਖੇਲੁ ਨ ਲਖਿਅਾ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dhayri Vasaaiaa Goindavaalu Acharaju Khaylu N Lakhiaa Jaaee.
translation: Guru Amar Das founded Goindval. The wondorous play could was beyond sight.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਤਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਖਸਮੈ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ॥੪੬॥
transliteration: Daati Joti Khasamai Vadiaaee ?46?
translation: Gift received from the earlier Gurus further enhanced the grandeur of the Light.

gurmukhi: ੪੭ ਗੁਰੂ ਰਾਮਦਾਸ ਤੇ ਗੁਰੂ ਅਰਜਨ ਦੇਵ
translation: Guru Ram Das and Guru Arjan Dev

gurmukhi: ਦਿਚੈ ਪੂਰਬਿ ਦੇਵਣਾ ਜਿਸਦੀ ਵਸਤੁ ਤਿਸੈ ਘਰਿ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dichai Poorabi Dayvanaa Jis Dee Vasatu Tisai Ghari Aavai.
translation: Liabilities of the previous births have to be settled and the thing goes to the house it belongs to.

gurmukhi: ਬੈਠਾ ਸੋਢੀ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਰਾਮਦਾਸੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਕਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Baitdaa Soddhee Paatisaahu Raamadaasu Satiguroo Kahaavai.
translation: Now Guru Ram Das, a Sodhi emperor, seated on the Guru-seat is called the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਨ ਤਾਲ ਖਟਾੲਿਅਾ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਸਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਜਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Pooranu Taalu Khataaiaa Anmritasari Vichi Joti Jagaavai.
translation: He got dug the complete holy tank and here settling down at Amritsar, he spread his light.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲਟਾ ਖੇਲ ਖਸੰਮ ਦਾ ੳੁਲਟੀ ਗੰਗ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰਿ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ulataa Khaylu Khasanm Daa Ulatee Gang Samoundri Samaavai.
translation: Wondrous is the play of the Lord. He can cause Ganges running in opposite direction merge in the ocean.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਤਾ ਲੲੀਅੈ ਅਾਪਣਾ ਅਣਿਦਿਤਾ ਕਛੁ ਹਥਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ditaa Laeeyay Aapanaa Aniditaa Kachhu Hadi N Aavai.
translation: You get your own; given nothing cannot bring to you anything.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਿ ਅਾੲੀ ਘਰਿ ਅਰਜਣੇ ਪੁਤ ਸੰਸਾਰੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਕਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dhiri Aaee Ghari Arajanay Poutu Sansaaree Guroo Kahaavai.
translation: Now the Guruship entered the house of Arjan (Dev) who, to say was the son, but, he proved through his good deeds to be worthy of the Guru-seat.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣਿ ਨ ਦੇਸਾਂ ਸੋਢੀਓਂ ਹੋਰਸਿ ਅਜਰੁ ਨ ਜਰਿਅਾ ਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jaani N Daysaan Soddheeaon Horasi Ajaru N Jariaa Jaavai.
translation: This Guruship would not go beyond Sodhis because none else can bear with this unbearable.

gurmukhi: ਘਰ ਹੀ ਕੀ ਵਥੁ ਘਰੇ ਰਹਾਵੈ ॥੪੭॥
transliteration: Ghar Hee Kee Vadu Gharay Rahaavai ?47?
translation: The thing of the House should remain in the House.

gurmukhi: ੪੮ ਗੁਰੂ ਹਰਿ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ
translation: Guru Hargobind

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜਿ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ ਪੰਜ ਪੀਰ ਛਠਮੁ ਪੀਰੁ ਬੈਠਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਭਾਰੀ
transliteration: Panji Piaalay Panji Peer Chhatdamu Peeru Baitdaa Guru Bhaaree.
translation: (From Guru Nanak to Guru Arjan Dev) Five pirs were there who drank from the five cups(of truth, contentment, compassion, dharama, discerning wisdom), and now the sixth great pir is holding the Guruship.

gurmukhi: ਅਰਜਨ ਕਾੲਿਅਾ ਪਲਟਿਕੈ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਹਰਿਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਸਵਾਰੀ
transliteration: Arajanu Kaaiaa Palati Kai Moorati Harigobind Savaaree.
translation: Arjan (Dev) transformed himself into Harigobind and sat majestically.

gurmukhi: ਚਲੀ ਪੀੜੀ ਸੋਢੀਅਾ ਰੂਪੁ ਦਿਖਾਵਣਿ ਵਾਰੋ ਵਾਰੀ
transliteration: Chalee Peerhee Soddheeaa Roopu Dikhaavani Vaaro Vaaree.
translation: Now the Sodhi lineage has started and they all will show their selves turn by turn.

gurmukhi: ਦਲਭੰਜਨ ਗੁਰੁ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਵਡ ਜੋਧਾ ਬਹੁ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Dalibhanjan Guru Sooramaa Vad Jodhaa Bahu Paraoupakaaree.
translation: This Guru, the vanquisher of armies, is very brave and benevolent.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਛਨਿ ਸਿਖ ਅਰਦਾਸਿ ਕਰਿ ਛਿਅ ਮਹਲਾਂ ਤਕਿ ਦਰਸੁ ਨਿਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Pouchhani Sikh Aradaasi Kari Chhia Mahalaan Taki Darasu Nihaaree.
translation: The Sikhs prayed and asked that they have seen the six Gurus (how many more are to come) .

gurmukhi: ਅਗਮ ਅਗੋਚਰ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਬੋਲੇ ਮੁਖ ਤੇ ਸੁਣਹੁ ਸੰਸਾਰੀ
transliteration: Agam Agochar Satiguroo Bolay Moukh Tay Sounahu Sansaaree.
translation: The true Guru, the knower of the unknowable and seer of the invisible told the Sikhs to listen to.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਪੀੜੀ ਸੋਢੀਅਾਂ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਨੀਵ ੳੁਸਾਰਿ ਖਲਾਰੀ
transliteration: Kalijougu Peerhee Soddheeaan Nihachal Neenv Ousaari Khalaaree.
translation: The lineage of the Sodhis have been established on the sound foundation.

gurmukhi: ਜੁਗਿ ਜੁਗਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਧਰੇ ਅਵਤਾਰੀ ॥੪੮॥
transliteration: Jougi Jougi Satiguru Dharay Avataaree ?48?
translation: Four more Gurus will come to earth (yuga 2, yuga 2 i.e. 2+2=4)

gurmukhi: ੪੯ ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ
translation: Waheguru mantar

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਵਾਸਦੇਵ ਵਵਾ ਵਿਸਨਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਜਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Satijougi Satigur Vaasadayv Vavaa Visanaa Naamu Japaavai.
translation: In Satyug, Visnu in the form of Vasudev is said to have incarnated and ‘V’ Of Vahiguru reminds of Visnu.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਅਾਪੁਰਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਹਰੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਨ ਹਾਹਾ ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਜਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Duaapari Satigur Haree Krisan Haahaa Hari Hari Naamu Japaavai.
translation: The true Guru of dvapar is said to be Harikrsna and ‘H’ of Vahiguru reminds of Hari.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੇਤੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਰਾਮ ਜੀ ਰਾਰਾ ਰਾਮ ਜਪੇ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Taytay Satigur Raam Jee Raaraa Raam Japay Soukhu Paavai.
translation: In the the treta was Ram and ‘R’ of Vahiguru tells that rembering Ram will produce joy and happiness.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਨਾਨਕ ਗੁਰ ਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਗਗਾ ਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਨਾਮੁ ਅਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kalijougi Naanak Gur Gobind Gagaa Gobind Naamu Alaavai.
translation: In kalijug, Gobind is in the form of Nanak and ‘G’ of Vahiguru gets Govind recited.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰੇ ਜਾਗੇ ਚਹੁ ਜੁਗੀ ਪੰਚਾੲਿਣ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Chaaray Jaagay Chahu Jougee Panchaain Vichi Jaai Samaavai.
translation: The recitations o f all the four ages subsume in Panchayan i.e. in the soul of the common man.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰੋ ਅਛਰ ੲਿਕੁ ਕਰਿ ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਜਪੁ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਜਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Chaaro Achhar Iku Kari Vaahaguroo Japu Mantr Japaavai.
translation: When joining four letters Vahiguru is remembered,

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂ ਤੇ ੳੁਪਜਿਅਾ ਫਿਰਿ ਤਹਾਂ ਸਮਾਵੈ ॥੪੯॥੧॥
transliteration: Jahaa Tay Oupajiaa Dhiri Tahaa Samaavai ?49?1?
translation: The jiv merges again in its origin.

gurmukhi: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
transliteration: Ik Oankaar Satigur Prasaadi ||

gurmukhi: ਬਾਣੀ ਭਾੲੀ ਗੁਰਦਾਸ ਭਲੇ ਕੀ ॥
transliteration: Baanee Bhaaee Gurdaas Bhalay Kee ||

gurmukhi: ਸੋਰਠਾ
transliteration: Soratthaa
translation: Sorath:

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸ ਓਨਮ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ॥
transliteration: Aadi Purakh Aadaysa , Aonam Sree Satigur Charan ?
translation: My Supplication to Ad(i) Purakh (Primordial Lord), salutation the holy feet of the True Guru (who is the embodiment of the Lord)

gurmukhi: ਘਟ ਘਟ ਕਾ ਪਰਵੇਸ ੲੇਕ ਅਨੇਕ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਸਸਿ ॥੧॥੧॥
transliteration: Ghat Ghat Kaa Paravaysa , Ayk Anayk Bibayk Sasi ?1?1?
translation: Like the moon, who though one, resides everywhere and in everyone and yet remains one.

gurmukhi: ਓਨਮ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ
transliteration: Aonam Sree Satigur Charana , Aadi Purakh Aadaysu ?
translation: Salutation in the holy feet of Satguru, the embodiment of glorious Waheguru who is the Primeval Lord.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਅਨੇਕ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਸਸਿ ਘਟ ਘਟ ਕਾ ਪਰਵੇਸ ॥੨॥੧॥
transliteration: Ayk Anayk Bibayk Sasi , Ghat Ghat Kaa Paravays ?2?1?
translation: He is like the moon, Who though one is present everywhere and yet remains one.

gurmukhi: ਘਟ ਘਟ ਕਾ ਪਰਵੇਸ ਸੇਸ ਪਹਿ ਕਹਤ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ghat Ghat Kaa Paravaysa , Says Pahi Kahat N Aavai ?
translation: Waheguru (Lord) who is all-pervading and whose extent cannot be defined even by Sheshnag (a mythological serpent with thousand heads),

gurmukhi: ਨੇਤ ਨੇਤ ਕਹਿ ਨੇਤ ਬੇਦੁ ਬੰਦੀ ਜਨੁ ਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Nayt Nayt Kahi Nayta , Baydu Bandee Janu Gaavai ?
translation: Whose praises Ved, Bhats and aIl others have been singing since eons and yet say-not this, not even this.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਮਧਿ ਅਰੁ ਅੰਤੁ ਹੁਤੇ ਹੁਤ ਹੈ ਪੁਨਿ ਹੋਨਮ
transliteration: Aadi Madhi Aru Antu , Houtay Hout Hai Pouni Honam ?
translation: Who was there in the beginning, in between era and will remain in future,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸ ਚਰਨ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਓਨਮ ॥੩॥੧॥
transliteration: Aadi Purakh Aadaysa , Charan Sree Satigur Aonam ?3?1?
translation: My supplication to Him through the holy feet of the True Guru in which He is totally effulgent. (1)
